Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ClementinaH
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night after a Silversea Cruise. I was somehow concerned because no other cruise passenger were staying there. It is very close from the port, aprox. 10 minute ride by a local taxi. (aprox. 10 Euros). It has a grand lobby, beautiful view. The Concierge was very efficient. There is a lot of security in the Hotel (metal detector in all the entrances). It is located walking distance from the Dolmabahce Palace. The rooms have a good size. I was surprised to see that the bathroom is not in its best condition. It has white silicon in the borders.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: pevast
Reviews.Content: A hotel close to perfect in all aspects. Fantatstic service from check in, concierge, house keeping to their fabolous breakfast. A hotel with contratst, an outside looking more of a glas silo to an interior with warmth and style. Spacious rooms, clean with all you can wish for in terms of gadgets, slippers, robes and even better beds. Have had better breakfasts but Ritz Carlton is very close to world class. Close to Taksim Square, easy access to shopping area, restaurant district and many sights. 10 minutes by cab to Topkapi. If you look for a great stay this is a sure thing.

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: G_Asherton
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a modern building on the top of a small hill. The interior is done in a typical hotel style, which would better fit in a older building. The rooms - we had a suite with a Bosphorus view - are good equipped and functional. The rooms are not necessarily large. Just below is a soccer stadium, which causes some noise during games and more relevant a good traffic jam. So be careful where you want to go during a game. The location of the hotel - for the purpose of sightseeing - is with some information from the concierge good. You are less than five minutes walk from Thaksim place and the shopping streets. Just below the hotel at the Bosphorus is the final station of a tram line which takes you directly to the main tourist attractions within 10-15 minutes. Tram is anyway more advisable as they don't get stuck in the traffic. Most helpful was the staff in the club level. In a very friendly, pleasant and personal way they helped us to manage our stay and could organize good tour guides, restaurants, ...

Reviews.Title: “Grand and elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sameer R
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate to stay at the Ritz Carlton for two nights, before our return to the States. The property is perched on a hillside, above a soccer stadium, and one would think that sights are inaccessible. However, its a short stroll down the hill to the tram or you can walk in the other direction towards bustling Taksim Square. The staff is quite attentive, and in fact, after we had an issue with a hotel taxi driver who took us on a circuitous route to dinner, the hotel manager provided complimentary breakfast for our stay. We did take advantage of the indoor pool and fitness center as the latter is modern and well equipped. Istanbul is a vibrant city, and if I were to return, I would stay at the Ritz again.

Reviews.Title: “Easy and comfortable stay every time”
Reviews.Author: semush
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel for the 3rd time again and we had a 3 month old baby this time. I really enjoyed it as always. The staff in the hotel is very helpful, friendly and pleasant. They showed a special attention to us and the baby this time. We really felt at home. The rooms are very spacious and quite. The location is perfect. And the breakfast is to die for. This is the best city hotel I've ever stayed in. I look forward to returning here soon.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: Richard L
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ritz-Charlton for three days prior to a cruise and found it to be a perfect choice. Some may find the location a bit difficult but once you learn the trick of going down the hill to go into the old town and returning to Taxim on the way back and walk down hill to the hotel it was very simple and not taxing on the legs. We did go the other direction once and quickly learned that is not the way to do it. Taxi's were everywhere and traffic requires some advance planning...but we were on vacation so time was not an issue. The views from the hotel over the Bosphorus were great and would not save the few dollars to not get a view.

Reviews.Title: “As good as ever...”
Reviews.Author: Julesee
Reviews.Content: We tried another hotel last time we were in Istanbul due to the Ritz being booked up, and realised the Ritz was still the place to be....great bedrooms and staff.... definitely our favourite place to stay in crazy Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Club room experience”
Reviews.Author: aussieNewYork
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the club room for three days over easter. We had beautiful views over the bosphorus and lived in the dining facilities (breakfast, afternoon snack and dinner) which provided a great variety of food, drinks and turkish delights. My son is a picky eater and we would order a burger from room service for dinner and have it delivered to the club dining area. So we eat with him, there is an amazing number of nuts in food in turkey. So if your children have nut allergies you need to be careful. I had no problems with taxis but loved walking down the hill to the tram which would take you well into the old city for 2 trl. We did that our first afternoon to visit the spice market, walked back over the galata bridge, ogled all the fish restaurants underneath, caught funicular (3 trl) up the hill (entrance is just over bridge on left) up to istikal st which is famous walking st. Bought tickets at tram for few trl and caught back up to taksim square as were tired. Then wandered back to the ritz thru the park. We used the pool which was large and facilities which were fine but not nearly as nice as the four seasons bosphorous. Also down the hill were ferries which are easy and fun to ride around between asia and old town. So would agree that there was not a lot of restaurants close to the ritz but if you can stay at the club levels, you can just relax in the hotel without having to run out. It was great for the family, baris the concierge was very helpful. Also dolmabache palace is just at bottom of the hill as well... So enjoyed the stay and public transportation is great, people willing to help english speaking tourists

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 5 star hotel in a not so good location and corrupt taxi drivers”
Reviews.Author: Dubaim0m
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great and a real Ritz Carlton once you get inside. The good things: The rooms are small but very nice with wonderful finishings in the bathrooms. The spa is incredible and the pool indoor pool unbelievable to say the least. My daughter and I used it every day after sightseeing and were usually the only ones there. We had wonderful facials and massages at the spa and the staff there were incredible. Breakfast was very good and by the end of our stay, one server had our hot breakfast beverages ready for us without asking. The bad thing: Locaion is a bit rough but magnified by the unethical cabbies in the "old town". We went into the old town every day and didn't think it would be a big deal as it's very close and just up the river. The first day we realized there was a problem when a taxi driver refused to take us back to the Ritz because of a "football" game... we'd hear this again and again for various reasons. We finally found the the train and took it back, walking up the hill to the hotel. Not a big deal during daylight but wouldn't want to do it at night. We got another taxi at the hotel (always good and ethical when you get them at the hotel) into town for a show... after the show my 10 year old daughter and I were told by the taxi driver that he had to drop us off a very long, dark block away from the hotel due to a "football" game (which didn't exist). I was quite angry and told him there wasn't a game and how dare he drop a woman and her 10 year old daughter off at night a deserted block from the hotel. He told me he'd watch me go in. Then I paid him, he took the money for a moment and then returned it to me saying it was ripped. I was so angry I found anther bill for him and left. The next night we had the same experience from the old time.... he couldn't drop us off at the hotel b/c a football game and then tried to change bills because the one I gave him was ripped. This is when I really understood this crooked game and told him take it or leave it as I didn't want his counterfiet money. He then proceeded to check out the bill he tried to slip to me in the light of his internal cab light as he thought it must look really fake for an American to notice. We then determined we couldn't go into the old town at night and would always come back via train before dark as the long empty block you have to walk past isn't a place you want to walk by as a mother with your daughter at night. Bottom line, if you are with your husband/boyfriend the walk back up from the train isn't a big deal but if you are alone as a woman or with your children and want to explore the old town don't stay here, stay in the old town at the Four Seasons. It's really a shame that Istanbul law enforcement hasn't done anything about these corrupt taxi drivers, there are even signs when you leave certain shows warning you about them. We currently live in Dubai and have traveled all over the world and have not ever seen anything so blatant and corrupt... probably because I was an American woman alone with her 10 year old daughter. I won't return to Istanbul for that reason alone there are plenty of other wonderful places to visit in the world. Shame on them.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Service, Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tennek
Reviews.Content: Had a very nice 5-day stay at the Ritz Istanbul. The city view suite that we had was a comfortable room, although the living room area was fairly small by the standards of suites to which we are accustomed. That said, there are really no other remotely negative comments about the hotel. The staff is particularly helpful while not being on top of you to the point of annoyance. Room service was accurate and very prompt. The breakfast buffet in the Lobby is quite expansive and is the way to begin the day. Eating well there can take you through to dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, Difficult location”
Reviews.Author: MargaretBarber
Reviews.Content: I loved staying in this hotel. The rooms were beautiful, the dining area was exceptional, and the food was amazing. The only issue I had with the hotel was that it's location was difficult for us. Traffic is a real issue in Istanbul, we were stuck in traffic in cabs up to 1 1/2 or 2 at a time during peak travel times. Most of the tourist attractions are in the old part of the city, and the hotel is in the new part, and is really too far to walk to the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Business and Relax”
Reviews.Author: Shoni_11
Reviews.Content: From the early arrival until the departure, everything in this Hotel works perfectlly, as expected in a Ritz Carlton; and the personal since the front entrance until the Club Floor are something really special. It is a must to stay with them.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Zeehash
Reviews.Content: Great location. 10 min walk to tram. To get to Sultanahmet it only took 20 mins on the tram. Taksim square and Istiklal Caddesi are a 15 minute walk in the opposite direction. You can get a ferry to the Asian side from across the tram stop. Would stay at the Ritz again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Travelwithfamily05
Reviews.Content: From service to location, from rooms to food....everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Club Lounge”
Reviews.Author: bobholt
Reviews.Content: Good value for money and excellent service would recommend checking out for price

Reviews.Title: “excellent 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: General_traveller
Reviews.Content: Everything is 5 star in this hotel. The huge rooms, the amenities, the excellent service, the public places, the breakfast with view of the Bosphorus. Only 2 negative things: The internet is extremely expensive ,and although next to Taksim Square,(and comparing to the other 5 stars hotels over there) the access by road is more difficult, meaning for the people that cannot or don't want to walk the 10 minutes uphill, they have to tolerate the awful traffic of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Subtle luxury”
Reviews.Author: merryole
Reviews.Content: Beautifully done furnishings. Look closely at the carpets in the reception area. Wonderfully comfortable beds. Superb service by hotel staff. For example: upon arrival we needed to replenish ready cash and asked directions to the nearest atm. The bell person personally took us two floors down in the elevator and escorted us down a hallway and a couple of turns to three atm devices. The hotel is a short walk up gradual hill to the Taksim area through a pleasant park. DolmabahÃ§e Palace is a few blocks downhill; the hill is also a gradual walk. The partial Bosphorus view is relaxing. Fronting that view is MaÃ§ka parki, also a short walk from the hotel. We like walking and enjoyed the stroll along DolmabahÃ§e Cadessi to the old Bosphorus Bridge. Began raining on the way back, so we grabbed a taxiâ€”they are readily available in the area. The Taksim Metro station is a reasonable walk; from there we were able to reach all places we wished to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Yeah, It's the Ritz.”
Reviews.Author: Sorefeettoproveit
Reviews.Content: Here's the thing with top end hotels, they have a very high standard to live up to, and that's just to be acceptable. It's almost a no win situation, the best you can do is be perfect, which is also the bare minimum. But this is what they charge for, and promise. In my experience, they usually fall short, because perfect just isn't realistic. But at the R.C.-IST, they actually did it, they were perfect. They location is good, a bit off the beaten track, but if you're a wanderer, it's easy to head down the hill and grab a ferry or mill around along the shore. As for the hotel itself, it was as expected, clean, beautiful and full service. The real impression was made by the staff. Due to circumstances I had to check in after a large group...surprise, surprise, all of the good rooms were gone. But, the reception went out of their way to place me into an upgraded room, respecting the long wait I had due to the large tour group ahead of me. Well done. Then, after that, the manager actually stepped out from behind the desk and personally thanked me for my patience, giving me her card and letting me know if there were anything I should need, just ask for her. Very impressive. It goes on from here, and I'll just say I did require some assistance (nothing major) and the help was always there, prompt, efficient and professional. This hotel has earned its reputation, and is worth the cost, if you're looking for top notch service and professionalism.

Reviews.Title: “First Stay in Istanbul and will NOT be the last.”
Reviews.Author: davidnhornby
Reviews.Content: The Ritz was all i could have hoped for. The welcome, hospitality, warmth and charm of the team there is superb! I love great service and therefore i love the RC Istanbul. We BOTH are loving it.......... Rooms great size, spa great, all good!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, impeccable taste, stanning views”
Reviews.Author: Baiser
Reviews.Content: hotel is located in business center which looks a little bit questionalble in this part of Istanbul - it's a black shining tower which absolutely does't match with architectural style of the district. Ritzs has several floors (0-15) of the tower, the rest belongs to business center and luxury apartments. What i didn't like is that you basicall cannot walk to the hotel - better be in a car - as tower stands on the hill and you have long and uncomfortable walk if you climb down or you have to walk up on the pandus when you come from embankment. Inside you have luxurious lobby, nice bar etc. Breakfast room is nice, but breakfast itself is rich, but nothing very special. View is not very good from breakfast room. Service is fine. I actually didn;t like that much service from concierge and portier (they looked helpful and smiling, but not very sincere and hospitable - you see what i mean, you don;t really feel yourself welcomed). Rooms are really great - taste, design, bedding is fabulous. I had bosphorus view and it was really nice..especially you may enjoy your view from the bed. From services: we have rented a private boat to travel to Princess islands. It worked, but was too expensive, boat was not exactly we were promised, crew was okay. Finally the walk was very fine, but you always feel yourself chitted. SPA is good, pool is quite big. BTW only pool is the shared zone for men and women, steamrooms and saunas are separated. I have feet massage, it was good, but not exeptional. Overall impression was very good, but it was more related to the city itself.

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz - Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: basitkhn
Reviews.Content: This was my first time Istanbul and I decided to stay at the Ritz. It was a great experience. Service was great, staff was super nice and cannot say enough about them; for example, I actually drop my new phone in the taxi and the staff working in the front door somehow got it back. I donâ€™t how they did it but the taxi driver was back in an hour with my phone, amazing. Also, the rooms are very nicely decorated, the food was very good and view from the hotel is unbelievable. Also, I wanted to especially thank the concierges; Filiz Kirmizigul and Menekse Goker. They were super helpful and in my short time, I was able to check out important sites in Istanbul. Overall, great experience and I higher recommend the Ritz to all.

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz -:Means Unique Elegance Capped with an Air of Romance”
Reviews.Author: Jermaine F
Reviews.Content: Firstly We are genuine visitors not some made up story teller. We stayed in a few hotels in different countries (Hilton,The Address,Sheraton,swissotel,marriott and so on......)I feel The Ritz tops. We came to Istanbul for our romantic holiday to get away from work stress etc just to have our "ME" time,we weren't disappointed. The Ritz Istanbul is just where to be to remind you of why you work so hard and what pampering is all about,We were met by the door men so polite and helpful scanned the bags etc and another 2 ushers,lead us to the reception(nice clean elegant lobby)my wife already had her eyes glowing with joy,in no time we were checked in offered us tea and Turkish delights ,Then escorted to our Deluxe suite,it was just what i needed,Excellent just perfect you just feel at home,the food the service ........everything about THE RITZ-CARLTON ISTANBUL is just as you always would want it to be Class with Excellence wrapped with comfort topped with that romantic touch!!!!!!! WE RECOMMEND IT.

Reviews.Title: “Always my choice in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: jonjacobson
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here on a number of occassions and would go back everytime. The service is excellent - they genuinely seem to take a personal interest in you from the moment you walk through the door. The rooms are decorated very nicely and well thought out. The one downside on this trip was there was an outdoor concert close to the hotel that went late into the night that can be heard from the rooms. Aside from this, you really can't go wrong staying at the Ritz in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz consistency second to none.”
Reviews.Author: RRM1020
Reviews.Content: We spent the night at the Ritz prior to our Bodrum trip. The Ritz is the Ritz. From the moment you step into the hotel you feel it. The service and care we received was on par for their standards. English speaking staff were helpful. Unlike other reviews, I thought the location was great. We did walk to outdoor market and surrounding local businesses (even got a Turkish cut and shave). I said, we only spent the night and wish we had more time to explore. The rooms are well appointed (forget which room we had but very nice bathroom) and clean. My room had a view of the Besiktas soccer stadium, if there were a game I'd be able to watch the match right form the room! We felt verry comfortable. Top notch. I want to make another trip to Bodrum at some point in my life and this will be another stop.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Namro
Reviews.Content: Nice spa and verry delicious meals clean room and comfortable

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect from the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: omara67
Reviews.Content: I am writing the review from my room in the ritz The rooms are great however they could add a kettle with some tea packs Also there isn't so many outlets when it comes to food, only the Mai restaurant and the bar Overall it is a very good experience

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best Hotel in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Ayla D
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a wonderful 3 nights stay at the Ritz and I must say it is simply the best in Istanbul. And I have already stayed at Swissotel, W and Four Seasons there, and nothing compares. Spacious Rooms, Hotel Luxury, fantastic spa and indoor pool, and unsurpassed customer service make the Ritz Carlton Istanbul very special. I know Guest Relations are trained to be warm and welcoming to guests, but this time I felt their attention was genuine and un-artificial. All special requests shared via email were provided at check-in, we didnâ€™t even have to remind them of anything. Guest Relations helped us to select places to go out to, gave us the best advice on shopping and followed up on our satisfaction the next day! Staff high professional standards, wonderful food, added to the luxury and grandness of the Ritz Carlton Istanbul will certainly make us want to repeat our stay.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel with a very friendly staff...”
Reviews.Author: gaggu
Reviews.Content: we spent 8 days in this hotel and were very pleased with the service of the hotel....and the staff also were very very helpful ....as my husband had run out of his medicines for taking insulin ...they arranged to get it for him...which would have been impossible for us to do in Turkey....and i don't know of how many other hotels would have done the same ........... the club lounge was superb with a wide selection of food and drinks... and service was impeccable....

Reviews.Title: “Ritz lives up to its name”
Reviews.Author: buster15
Reviews.Content: Well located on the hill leading up to Taksim and Nisantasi, The Ritz Carlton remains one of Istanbul's best deluxe hotels. Service is impeccable in every way, and rooms with views of the Bospherous are spectacular. Corner and front Bospherous rooms are very roomy and the suites are bigger and more comfortable than you could want. The buffet breakfast is equal to the best with extremely responsive wait staff. The doormen are also exceptional completing a good-feeling hotel visit. There are two or three hotels in Istanbul that are its equal - but if you find a good rate and the location is right for you - try it. We have stayed many times - and it remains our favourite along with both Four Seasons and the Park Hyatt. All rank amongst our favourite hotel experiences anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and great location”
Reviews.Author: Kyle D
Reviews.Content: Entering the lobby you are greeted with luxurious Ottoman charm, Turkish delights, and tea. The food is exquisite (don't miss the brunch!!), bar/lounge tasteful, and spa relaxing (make sure to get a traditional massage). What makes the hotel unparalleled is the personal service of the staff. We stayed a full week and the concierge helped us plan each day visiting Istanbul's sights and restaurants. I look forward to coming back next time I visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz service and amenities, away from main attractions”
Reviews.Author: Parkinsummer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Isranbul to combine business with a quick family getaway. First of all, if you want four star service and four star surroundings, I would recommend the Four seasons on the Bosporus or the four seasons in the old city. The ritz is located across the bridge in taksim square and the hotel itself is located on the top of a small hill overlooking a football stadium. If you would like to stroll out the door and into the aya Sofia then look elsewhere. There is a car dealership downstairs and that's about it for places to stroll to. But the service is typical ritz plus something extra, the rooms are large and well appointed and there is an endless supply of turkish delight in the lobby. The staff were very warm and particular kind to our 2 year old son, lavishing him with snacks and toys as well as hugs and pats on the head. There is a gym and indoor swimming pool (like most indoor swimming pools with low ceilings, it appears better in photos than in reality). There is a lounge downstairs and a formal and informal restaurant upstairs. The old city is a 15 minute drive across the bridge, but depending on traffic, this can extend to 30 min or more. There is also a tram system, but you have to make your way down the hill and cross some pedestrian unfriendly roads to get to the station which was not an option with a toddler and a stroller. Overall, the ritz is a great hotel but given the superior locations of other similarly nice and pricey hotels, I would give it a pass next time to try out one of the 2 four seasons. It is a great location for conferences, which seems to be its mainstay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, even better service.”
Reviews.Author: Teeps18
Reviews.Content: From the moment of arriving into the lobby, we were greeted with snacks and hot drinks prior to checking-in. This was the start of an unparalleled service that lasted for the duration of our stay. The conference facilities were great, the food was delicious and varied and the rooms were very well equipped with bath & shower and one of the most comfortable beds I have slept in. The spa and gym were also to a high standard and the attentiveness of all members of staff was second to none. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous views and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: GlobalNomadLondon71
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights just before Christmas (although booked in for 4 nights). Nice: Great staff (concierge - Cenk Caner - and restaurant staff, in particular), amazing breakfast choice - I have not seen such an array of delights before! Spa, Not-so-nice: slightly remote in a windswept plaza and a trek to Taksim given local taxis normally refuse such a short fare, somewhat dated decor (or perhaps it is just the "grand" style), not inexpensive!

Reviews.Title: “Service and Luxury at the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: jmb06
Reviews.Content: This hotel definitely deserves its 5-star rating. The service from EVERYONE was outstanding; there is simply nothing to fault. We had a beautiful (standard) room with a partial water view. All amenities you would expect, plus chocolates upon arrival and nightly turn-down service. Breakfast was lovely, and again the high level of service enhanced it further. Bar/lounge also super; didn't try restaurant for anything besides breakfast. Though you could spend all day and evening touring Istanbul, I highly recommend taking time for the fitness room, pool, jacuzzi -- and the locker/changing room itself is luxurious. I did not try any of the additional spa services, but I'm sure they are great as well. Our only negative: you must walk through a rather dicey block or so directly outside the hotel to get to Taksim and other areas of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: StevenVHG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel to celebrate New Year 2011 in Istanbul. First view of the hotel is not "WOW" but once you enter the lobby things change. We had the option of the "club lounge" (which I advise to book because you get a lot of extra like seperate free bar at level 12 all day long) and seperate check in at level 12 (do not wait downstairs in the lobby!). Our room was not ready yet (this is not up to this level of hotel because it was already 3h in the afternoon...). The room was a "partial Bosphorus view room", not to big but rest ok, partial Bosphorus view, partial nothing view :), and smelled as a smoking room :(. This together with a rather noisy airconditioning system were the only bad points during our stay in Ritz Carlton. The rest was very good. Nice breakfast buffet, beautifull spa and one of the best (read: warm and friendly) hotel staff I have ever seen, from bell boy till manager. The Hotel has a good location also, in the middle of Istanbul ; right you go to the historical side and left is the good restaurant / bar side. So a little travel always but never a long travel. Go for it, ask a good room and use the Club lounge and you have a perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “Home on the other side of the world”
Reviews.Author: mrsregino
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ritz Istanbul for a week. Loved it. You can't miss the breakfast buffet or the spa. Location is on the European side of Istanbul, so there are plenty of things to do. Hotel has high security, so expect to go through something similar to airport security every time you access the premises. The lounge is very comfortable and has an amazing view!

Reviews.Title: “Service excellence; decent location”
Reviews.Author: michaelbtoronto
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in a Ritz-Carlton and we immediately discovered why the Ritz-Carlton holds training courses for other hotel chains. Every member of the staff was courteous and attentive, without being overbearing or snobby, a rare quality in a hotel chain that caters to a specific clientele. We were told that there are no rooms, other than a presidential suite, that face the old town. We opted for a corner room that faced the Bosphorus (full Bosphorus), which was fine. Our room could have used a refurbishment as some of the furniture and carpet looked past its useful life. That being said, however, the shower was the best one I have encountered bar none. Whatever the opposite of a water-saver shower head is, this hotel has it. Hold on! The spa was lovely, although being completely underground makes lying on a beach chair around the pool feel a bit strange. The only meal we ate was the buffet breakfast and what I can say is "bacon!" It was excellent, but after two weeks in Turkey, I essentially ate all of the bacon available at this hotel. I would stay here again. The walk to Taksim is an uphill affair, past a somewhat dodgy encampment. We never felt unsafe but were taken off guard with people sleeping in a park (behind a fence, so don't fret when you read this). The hotel could have done a better job catering to the tourist who likes to discover things on foot rather than just for those who cab it everywhere. We walked back and forth to Taksim several times, which you will do considering every taxicab will take you for a ride, except those you hail from inside the hotel compound directly. And, it was the best send-off from any hotel we have encountered. We were shown to a taxi and several members of the staff thanked us for our visit and we felt like they genuinely meant it. Bravo.

Reviews.Title: “One word, AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: megib
Reviews.Content: This hotel is outstanding! From the moment you walk in the door, you have first class service. The food at this hotel is wonderful and had live music the days that we were there. The location is amazing, a quick walk from taksim square and at the bottem of the hill is the tram, that you can get into the heart of the city. The front desk staff by the end of the week knew all our names, and were so amazing. Our stay was so great because of the people at this hotel. I can not say enough wonderful things about them!!

Reviews.Title: “The RC is all about service- and the Club Lounge does not disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: loveluxuryholidays_9
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 6 adults and spent a long weekend at the Ritz Carlton in Istanbul. We stayed on the Club Level and thought that the level of service and the choice of food was excellent. Club level includes all food and drink (alcoholic and soft) available in the club lounge free of charge. For breakfast, lunch and dinner there is a decent buffet of hot and cold food and this is supplemented with various cakes and sandwiches and other snacks available throughout the day. All of the staff at the hotel were very polite and helpful, something that, to me, is synonymous with the RC brand, but at other hotels of the same price range can sometimes be lacking. The hotel has two swimming pools. There is a large indoor pool surrounded by loungers and a large hot tub. Inside each of the changing rooms there is a sauna/ steam room, hot tub and showers with massive shower heads. The leisure facilities were included in the price and I definitely recommend you go! There is also a sun deck with a view over the city, this has numerous sun loungers, a bar, a swimming pool and two hot tubs. We loved sitting in the hot tubs in the early evening. I donâ€™t think the outdoor leisure facilities are very clear from the website, but they were a lovely surprise and give you a bit of â€œbeach holiday feelâ€� on a city break. The hotel is a short walk from Taxim Square and about 10 mins from the tram. The hotel has its own taxi rank if you donâ€™t want to/cant walk to the tram but the roads seemed to be very busy with traffic almost all of the time so we found the tram the quickest way to get around. I would highly recommend this hotel to visitors to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the Morning to ya!”
Reviews.Author: TraveltimeSS
Reviews.Content: The wife stayed at this hotel during our Honeymoon. Man, Ive stayed at Ritz-Carltons before but holy cow, this was a heck of a hotel. Everything just look so stunning. As soon as you walk into the hotel, you are greeted by so many friendly faces. The hotel lobby was just beautiful. Even as we were being checked in, we were being offered drinks and snacks. I especially loved the selection of Turkish delights. (Try the pistachio one!). Try to ask for a view facing the sea. We also loved the breakfast that they provided. Also the spa was unbelievable as well. The rooms were decorated so eloquently, we really felt like on the top of the world. There is plenty to do around the hotel, just be prepared to be walking on a lot of hills. We'll definitely try to return one day and completely recommend staying at this hotel for a couple on their honeymoon. The only downside is that the hotel is a little pricey, BUT BUT BUT its the Ritz, what do you expect! :)

Reviews.Title: “Very Good service & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Ywij
Reviews.Content: Thanks to all staff specially front office's staff & lounge's staff , you did very good job & service , make my friends feel your amazing service...specially your kindness & caring for my friends who feel sick while stay there Rooms absolutely clean & feel like home...sleeping like baby when touching the bed...location quite far from taksim square & the walking distance like climbing the hills :)...

Reviews.Title: “Nice position”
Reviews.Author: danieldenoto
Reviews.Content: This is a good international hotel with a good location for your journey to Istanbul even if it hasn't anything special except the view that's very nice especially if you have a room with a view over the Bosphorous. A good idea for dinner during summertime could be the terrace restaurant. It can become very difficult to move from the hotel if there's a football game in the next Besiktas stadium but if you are a football fun you could see the game from your room, if with sea view!!!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury means Ritz Calrton Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: PareshN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of the business conference, the rooms were amazing, but the bathroom was pure marble luxury! Bit pricy but gives you what you pay for! Fantastic food and cafateria and very nice bar downstairs. Very nice and professional and young looking staff and very well trained!

Reviews.Title: “divine”
Reviews.Author: em m
Reviews.Content: So it actually has been a long time since I was at this hotel the trip i took with a close friend of mine was actually in 2007 but I do remember i got stay 3 nights get the 4th night free from hotels.com and I could not believe the service and luxury. Also to find out that all day included food and drinks ( including alcoholic) were available. And it wasn't crappy street food. The hotel and room was so nice that after a long day out on my feet I'd relish in the idea that I going to the most comfortable and luxurious place in all of Istabul.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Place, Amazing City”
Reviews.Author: Pedro G
Reviews.Content: Besides the expected of a Ritz (large rooms, beautiful hotel, great service), This hotel has an excellent view of the Bosphorus, great restaurant and Incredible Brunch. Is pretty close to Dolmabache palace and the river walk so taking the tour to Dolmabache is quite simple as well as taking the bosphorus tour. If you are planning to be in the hotel of some time, request the optional lounge club subscription, that way you have breakfast and appetizers (pretty much you can eat the whole day), have a really nice night cap every day (champagne, cognac, whisky, Wine) as well as free WIFI (which is kind of expensive in your room)

Reviews.Title: “Top Marks”
Reviews.Author: allan09
Reviews.Content: Nothing is too much trouble at this ideally situated hotel, ideally situated for the tourist attractions and ideally situated for local bars, restaurants and nightclubs. The staff, without exception, cannot do enough to make your stay memorable, and the little extras, like the Turkish Delight Mountain every time we passed through the lobby, are the icing on the cake! Accommodation is as expected, beautifully furnished, immaculately clean, with the most luxurious bed you can imagine - we slept like a top every night.

Reviews.Title: “The best trip we had”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeKAP
Reviews.Content: We spend a week and then two more days on the way back The hotel is very good. The location is super convenient. Right next to Taksim Square. A tram stop is down the hill with a 5 mins walk. This gets you into the Sultanahmed in 15 mins by tram. This is very convenient on the way back when you donâ€™t want to haggle for taxis. The rooms are nice, upto the usual standard of Ritz. Spacious, quality furnishings, super clean. The bathroom, is done is modern Turkish style very good looking. The toiletries are one of good quality. Unlike other hotels, they donâ€™t compromise on small things that irritate. Instead of only one â€œwelcome drinkâ€�, it is a free flow in the lobby which you can drink when ever you are passing by. There is a selection of Turkish Delights in the lobby. For a holiday these are good touches. The pillow chocolates are solid pieces of good quality not a wafer thin slice which leaves an oily coating in the mouth. The staff is truly exceptional. The concierge team of Cenk, the Head Concierge is superb. They know the city inside out, provide great advice and are very helpful. We followed all their advice and enjoyed each of them including a foot-ball match in the stadium next door! Their advice ranged from a hidden restaurant in Spice market â€“ the best meal I had in Istanbul, sight seeing (Chora Church was their find), night club (donâ€™t go to Cuba, it is cramped, better go to 360), belly dancing show(food is not that good, eat before you go there), cruise (take the ferry instead of a night cruise), views of Istanbul at night from the viewing deck at Sapphire My wife lost her wallet during the trip and the staff was most helpful. Deniz (Manager) called police a number of times, the reception called the Sofia Museum gift shop where we thought it was dropped and Cenk called the Tourism police. Deniz wrote a personal note to my wife and sent her an Evil Eye for protection and to cheer her up. The staff are overall very friendly and have a great eye for detail. The bell-boy Mert would check that there is nothing left in the cup-boards, safe and remembers that one of our bags has to be marked fragile. The doorman makes it a point to check which airport we are going to (Istanbul has 2 airports, though only one is really used for international flights). There is free wi-fi in the lobby and also two lap-tops for general use. Room service food is from the restaurants so is the same quality. The rooms don't have kettle but room service gets you hot water/milk at no charge and no grumble. The spa is one of the best we have been to. The equipment of very high quality and they maintain it very clean. The indoor pool, sauna, Jacuzzi are all very good. The gym is all modern and spacious with marked areas for everything. The coffee areas has very good staff and wonderful views of the Bosphorous. They have good quality musicians playing there at mealtimes.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Trip :)”
Reviews.Author: TheNormal
Reviews.Content: This is surely one of the best trips that I have taken in years ï�Š .. and guess what ? .. staying at the Ritz Carlton Hotel was the best choice that we have made. I think this is what you can call HOME AWAY FROM HOME. The Staff and Management were most helpful and cheerful all the way from CHECK-IN to CHECK-OUT. They have attended to all our needs and request no matter how small or big they were. And their Concierge Team was one of the best and most professional that I have dealt with in years. If you are you are planning to visit Istanbul please check out the Ritz-Carlton .. you will never regret it ï�Š

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and Luxury”
Reviews.Author: JohnsonCJ2
Reviews.Content: The Ritz name is synonymous with luxury and in Istanbul it certainly fits. The Ritz is close to Taxim Square an ideal place to drink some coffee or watch people.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay at the Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: Joseph G
Reviews.Content: We had the most wonderful time at the Ritz Carlton Istanbul, the staff was helpful an made our stay the best ever. Our family can't wait to return to parardise. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Sept. in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: gray1216
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz for 5 nights in Sept. My 80+ year old mother accompanied us. The only thing that blemished our stay was that one of our 2 rooms was not ready on arrival. They told us that it would be ready within 2 hours and it was. They then sent us 2 complimentary massages at the spa for the inconvenience. We agreed that these massages were among the best we ever had. The service was impecable. The staff was friendly, competent and went out of their way to help us. The assistant concierge, Ms. Menekse Goker, was particularly helpful in guiding us to restaurants. The assortment she helped us choose could not have been better. At one of them my mother admired the service plates. She had hoped to order a set to take home, but when we were unable to do so, Ms. Goker secured one for us as a momento. This is truly service that one rarely experiences. You will not be disappointed if you stay at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Bosphorus views”
Reviews.Author: SaveyFLTraveler
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Ritz-Carlton at the end of a cruise. As expected, it was a beautiful hotel, well-run, comfortable, with great facilities. Breakfast was wonderful. We enjoyed a terrific Ramadan dinner buffet here. Our room had nice views of the city and the Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like a Sultan at the Ritz in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: CDRO
Reviews.Content: I had to go to Istanbul for business beginning of October and there I was treated like a Sultan. The location is a bit out of the old town, Sultan Ahmet, but the views over the Bosphorus are breathtaking, since it is the tallest building in the area. You are looking down on the Besiktas stadium and you can see the teams play on the pitch. The food is delicious and make sure to have breakfast while sitting next to the window. The staff already knows after a few minutes who you are, what you eat and how to make your stay more comfortable. Traffic is horrible, so during rush hours it is good to walk up to taksim square and then take the funicular down to Kabatas, there you take the streetcar leading to SultanAhmet. excellent. You can buy tokens at the vending machines at every stop. when traffic is ok, then take a taxi. You can also walk via taksim square through the istikal street all the way down to galati and across the Golden Horn. Istanbul is my favorite European city. By the way great food at Ortakoy a taxi right down, from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz has done it again”
Reviews.Author: DEV_DESAI0411
Reviews.Content: I visited Istanbul this summer and we stayed at the ritz Carlton on the Asian side of this wonderful city. First of all the city is the best I have ever visited , after Paris of course. It's architecture is well integrated with modernism. As for the hotel, what can I say , ? It was surely an out of the world experience. The building however is only half hotel and the top most floors are all residential. The scintillating tinted windows and the height of the structure will surely grab your attention in taksim square. It is located at walking distance from the hyatt and on the banks of the bospherous , a piece of property every Turkish craves for and a view every traveller strives to soak in . Surely a feast for the eyes. The interior are well decorated and the receptionist and the sentinel are warm and friendly. They do everything in your favour to make you feel home. The rooms with club access are great with breath taking views of the river. As for the club lounge, there is plenty to eat and drink and I went ballistic at the gamut of pastries and sweets , which included the famous bakhlawa. The breakfast is spectacular and there's a large spread every morning from I guess 7 to 11 a.m. the spa is said to be exquisite and relaxing and has facilities like steam ..... Turkish bath or hamam as they call it. My parents gave it a thumbs up and of all the thing I was ALLOWED to do, I found the swimming pool the winner. In the reception you will find a few bowls of sweetened marshmallows, they call it something but I can't recollect it. From the 20 foot ceilings to the cobbler in the lobby to the various carpet shops in the basement to the food , the experience truly felt like a royal treat. If you stop by in Istanbul or are deciding to spend your vacations in turkey you must stay at the ritz Carlton Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place but watch out for concerts”
Reviews.Author: alex655
Reviews.Content: We had a very good time at Ritz Carlton Istanbul. Staff is very professional and helpful. Rooms are quite big, well equiped and clean. Pool is also very nice with sauna and hammam. All the restaurants we went at night were booked by concierge. Places offered good food and were not too pricey. There's only one weak point, hotel is very close to a concert place so you should call them first or ask them for a quiet room. Our first night we got like an hour of rehearsal so we told them and they nicely got us another room thus we were in a quiet zone for the concert night! We'd recommand the place.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz I Expected”
Reviews.Author: Wrightway4010
Reviews.Content: The Ritz should be the best - this left something to be desired. Service was only average. Room was up to ritz standards, but food and service staff were un-interesting and un-interested. I'd stay elsewhere for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot match other luxury hotels in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: discovermore
Reviews.Content: The Ritz is no match for other luxury hotels in the city. My favorites are the Cirigan Palace Kempinski and the two Four Seasons - there are others. Let's start with what works - interior spaces (lobby, bar, restaurant, shops) are well appointed and comfortable and the service is attentive and welcoming. Location is poor and with Istanbul traffic, coming and going for business or tourism a major undertaking and requires patience and waste valuable time. The walls and doors do little to contain sound, the views are very urban and the hotel is surrounded with traffic. The rooms are okay but a bit tired looking. Having seen better in the City, i would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven for Ritz Carlton Fans”
Reviews.Author: pcinbk
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Ritz Carlton Istanbul is true to what I believe the chain would like it to be. If you are a fan, this is good: the decor is standard Ritz Carlton, classic with some vague local touches; the rooms are extremely comfortable with small touches that make a big difference; the service is excellent, discreet and friendly as I have generally found it to be in Istanbul. In my room (actually a suite), the views were beautiful, there was virtually no noise from inside or outside the hotel, and everything was in perfect condition. Of course, if you prefer a more modern or even slightly more interesting experience, as I do, you may want to stay elsewhere (either of the Four Seasons for instance.) That said, there is absolutely nothing to complain about and the hotel deserves praise for being true to what guests expect. One last caveat: the location is practical IF you don't want to walk from the hotel, as it is an unpleasant 15 minute stroll up a hill to get to anything.

Reviews.Title: “The best Ritz I've stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: troutfishermanfl
Reviews.Content: Fantastic staff! They truly are there to please, just fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great View”
Reviews.Author: GoingGlobal79
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days in Istanbul with the Family in July 2011 and this hotel was great. A bit removed from the main sights but the views it provides especially from the open air bar off the lobby are fantastic. Great experience especially in the Spa.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Expectations”
Reviews.Author: cchriscap
Reviews.Content: wonderful view. rooms were very spacious yet hard to find internet connection. Staff in the resturants and the bars were excellent! Food is wonderful! Lot of security, you and your bags are scanned each time you enter hotel. Lousy location in the city if you like to walk. Front desk and concieriege staff were not up to par as we were given bad directions and poor service. I would think twice before i would return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with not so good location.”
Reviews.Author: faarias
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton is a very nice hotel with great service with an unfortunate location in the middle of a lot of traffic and housed in a very unattractive building. Service and security was great at the hotel and the interior itself is very attractive with beautiful views of the Bosphorus. The lobby has a small table with delicious Turkish Delight for guests and we took advantage of a quick taste at every opportunity. The lobby was crowded at times with large tour and cruise groups which could feel a bit hectic. We reserved a twin bedded Garden View room and the room was very spacious with a side view of the Bosphorus and the surrounding greenery. The bathroom was very nicely decorated and included a mixture of traditional Turkish tiles and marble. We had dinner on the terrace overlooking the Bosphous and this was very nice, with great food and excellent athmosphere and views. Breakfast at the restaurant was also very nice and varied as you would expect form this type of hotel. The location of the building was OK for our private tours, but it is not well suited for walking. However, we did do the uphill climb towards Taksim Square and took a cab back. The outdoor pool area was small and quite often windy in the afternoons, the indoor pool was nice but the whirlpool was cold. The spa area was beautiful with very nice lockers including a Turkish hammam. It was a nice stay with great service and the price was great; however, next time we may try one of the other hotels on the Bosphorus itself or in Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “typical carlton”
Reviews.Author: yatsey
Reviews.Content: the main positive of this hotel were the very large room. if your trip is just for business then you wouldnt need to look much further. the bar and restaurant also had extensive menus with good quality and reasonable priced food. The main negative is the location at the top of the hill, although it is reasonably close to the tram stop for getting to the tourist sites. service was ok although concierge was not as helpful as I would have hoped which was the only disapointment of my visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bad location”
Reviews.Author: erlan7
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel, but the location was poor. Also no swimming activities over there and only 2 bars.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Foster70
Reviews.Content: Typical Ritz, very high quality, clean and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful accommodations, wonderful staff, OK location”
Reviews.Author: RalphSchmitt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ritz for three nights 8/15-18. We were upgraded to an outstanding room on the 11th floor facing east across the Bosphorus. The accommodations were beautiful, the staff was unfailingly wonderful(warm, efficient, professional, helpful), the breakfast buffet was excellent with a wide selection (part of our price), and the spa was soothing & attractive. The only negatives were a location that was away from wherever you might want to go and an informal restaurant (the Terrace) that was disappointing. Nothing can be done about the location, which was easlily solved with relatively inexpensive cab rides. The Terrace restaurant, on the other hand - although beautifully done with open-air architecture - had service that was inattentive (~10 PM), live music that was too loud, and food that was barely adequate. Solution: don't go there.

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Beautiful Hotel that ticks all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: maria g
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this amazing hotel for our 30th wedding anniversary prior to taking a mediterranean cruise. From the moment we entered the hotel we experienced warmth, kindness and helpfulness in every way from the professional staff. We were upgraded to a beautiful Bospherous view room and were presented with a lovely cake and bottle of wine which was greatly appreciated. Our room was large and extremely comfortable. We enjoyed delicious food together with very good service. This hotel is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. The staff were all great and the outstanding person was Filiz Kirmizigul at Concierge. We had a few problems with lost luggage and health and she went beyond the call of duty and was very caring, kind and helpful in every way Thank you so much Filiz you're a treasure. We also met the Manager who is really lovely. Thank you so much and we will be back again hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here if you enjoy a good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: feelreel
Reviews.Content: After having stayed at the Ritz in Tokyo not too long ago - one of the best hotel experiences ever - I decided to give the one in Istanbul a try. Unfortunately, this wasn't a repeat performance. While the staff was extremely helpful and friendly, the hotel has no sound proofing whatsoever. I tried two different rooms facing two different directions, and on the one side I had massive traffic noise and on the other a pool side party. I guess they hadn't discovered double or triple pane windows in Istanbul when the hotel was built 10 years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a first timer in the city...”
Reviews.Author: harryterry2319
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family in the Club Lounge and it was well worth the additional cost. The staff is extremely attentive and helpful. The extra perks such as complimentary mineral water, breakfast and nibbles throughout the day are another nice touch in the lounge floor...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: roadrage56
Reviews.Content: My family and I (2 kids aged 8 and 5) stayed at this hotel for 10 days and had a great time. From before we arrived the hotel staff were tremendous - no ask was too hard for them! I chose this hotel because of it's pools (Indoor and Outdoor) since I needed somewhere for the kids to play after long days of sightseeing (Istanbul is one of the most fascinating cities in the world) and here's what I found. Positives: Great location with views of the sea and also walking distance to downtown (Taksim) and also Katabas (tram to Old City). Fabulous staff and great ambiance. Fabulous indoor pool and spa. Taxis are cheap but public transporting is convenient, cheaper (kids go free) and close by. Things to think about: The outdoor pool can get very windy and difficult to enjoy.Also, the outdoor pool is small and disappointing for a Ritz! The walk to Taksim is short but the hill is pretty steep if you have walking difficulties. Also, while the hotel is good at recommending upscale restaurants (and they are fancy) it is worth exploring other options as there are many with great location and atmosphere at a much lower cost.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed rooms, good service and attentiv staff”
Reviews.Author: Gtrain217
Reviews.Content: Location great, but traffic and ease of access by road challenging Ask for a room with a view of the waterway, it is spectacular

Reviews.Title: “Great staff but very removed from the city in all aspects”
Reviews.Author: Riverzlad
Reviews.Content: It's a poor location, you're forced to cab-it everywhere (or be up for really long walks) and you're entirely removed from the culture and feel of the city. If you want a Western hotel completely removed from the vibe of the city (with great service), then this place is for you. It felt like the crowd was all business types in suits which admittedly, is far from what I like. I imagine there are plenty of great hotels in Istanbul with a better location and more character. I will say (as is to be expected) the staff and food were great.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HeatherSydenham
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here before a cruise of the Black Sea. Room was excellent, very comfortable bed and loads of pillows, duvet a bit too hot, but blanket in the closet. Water not fit to drink but bottles of water supplied at no cost. Breakfast buffet was really good and the service throughout was excellent. We ate on the terrace for two nights as they do a sort of barbecue out there and really enjoyed the meals. It was lovely sitting out and watching the ships etc on the Bosphorus. Wonderful Turkish Delight in the lobby to help yourself to, and wonderful cherry juice to help yourself to. This seemed to be available at any time of the day or evening. Checking out was really quick, but as so many people arrived at the same time, checking in was slower, but still only took about 15 minutes of waiting.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: KeLLyc0n
Reviews.Content: The ritz carlton istanbul: If location, ambiance, service and timeless fad free style are what you want, this hotel is simply the best in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service makes a large hotel seem more intimate”
Reviews.Author: tuckie
Reviews.Content: To me, it's getting the little things right that defines exceptional customer service...and this is where the RC Istanbul excels. One of our "wow" experiences was when sent up a birthday cake to our room. How did they know it was my birthday? They noticed by birth date on my passport at check-in. And the next morning the wonderful staff at the front desk all extended their best wishes as well. One can get a little jaded when traveling and come to expect high levels of service. It's always the little touche that make you realize that an experience is extraordinary. Clearly the RC Istanbul understands this and amazingly seems to have hired a staff that understands this as well. We had stayed at the Four Seasons Sultanahmet earlier in our trip so the contrast was interesting. Both locations have their benefits. The Four Seasons is the perfect location for the major tourist sites and being able to walk out the door and reach them in 10 minutes was wonderful. The RC's location was a great base to explore up the Bosphorus. We visited Bebek, Ortakoy and the Rumeli fortress...all quick taxi rides away. Rumelli offered great views and was practically deserted when we were there. Fair warning...there's a lot of climbing involved and there are no handrails but the rewards were worth it. Bebek was fine, nothing special, a few boutiques and stores. Ortakoy was more interesting and we had a lovely lunch right on the water at the House Cafe. And it is only a 10 minute walk (uphill) to Istiklal street and 10 minute walk (downhill) to the Dolmabahce Palace. If you do go to Istiklal eat lunch at one of the restaurants on the left side of the street (going down the hill) that offers rooftop dining. The views across the Golden Horn are beautiful. From Istiklal it isn't a far walk to the Galata Tower and if you're feeling ambitious continue down the hill, cross the bridge and the spice market is right there. If you are traveling with children you'll be happy that there's an outdoor pool. The pool itself is quite small but there are a number of loungers and a lovely grass area that doubles as a lounge. The children loved a dip after a morning of sightseeing and there's a bar to amuse the adults. Overall we had a wonderful experience at the RC Istanbul, but it is the staff that truly defines this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING CUSTOMER SERVICE AND BEAUTIFUL PROPERTY”
Reviews.Author: hazzy724
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an amazing customer service and luxury property, the RC Istanbul is where to go. Just imagine not having to worry about anything during your stay and having the staff wait on you hand and foot. No job is too big or too small for anyone. I cannot tell you how happy I was staying at this wonderful property! Also, be sure to check out their spa. The Turkish Bath is a wonderful experience. 5 stars all around!

Reviews.Title: “This was what you call 5 star...we were so SPOILED”
Reviews.Author: dalairoma
Reviews.Content: This was the BEST hotel experience we've ever had. We stayed for 5 nights and every minute we were inside the Ritz was pure bliss. From the moment of our entry on the first day, we were greeted with extreme hospitality. My daughter, who's very active and full of mischievous ideas was treated as a princess with toys, attention, big smiles, and several ice-packs. Everyone went above and beyond to ensure our satisfaction whether it was making special arrangements for us in the lounge area, celebrating my husband's birthday with a cake and candles. My family's trip to istanbul was made even more memorial by the exceptional quality of this hotel. The rooms were very maintained, our room service calls were immediately responded to, and anything else we requested (even diapers) were quickly attained. The breakfast was delicious and the view is spectacular. Don't hesistate on staying here..it's a no brainer!!!!

Reviews.Title: “They could not have been nicer!”
Reviews.Author: celebrationtiger
Reviews.Content: I have never seen such good customer service. We checked in having made our reservations with Amex Platinum. Thus we were entittled to an upgrade if available. They not only provided the upgrade but gave us a choice of three different rooms:, suite no view, or rooms with a view of the Bosphorous. It was nice to have a choice and actually see the rooms. We took the suite since we were going off on a cruise and space is a priority with us. The hotel has recently been refurbished and the two room suite was lovely. Orhan Karadeniz could not have beeen more gracious. Because we are Marrriott Platinum he extended lounge privileges and free internet. The lounge was so well done and the food so good, dinner was unnecessary unless you desired it. It is the best lounge I have seen in a long while and definitely worth the extra price even if you have to pay for it. The buffet breakfast downstairs was also sumptuous. The location of the hotel is quite far from the old city, but the hop on hop off bus made that not a problem and it is very close to the Dolmabahce Palace. The Spa was fine, but it would be helpful if there was a bit more English understood by the masseuse.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel in a truly fabulous location..”
Reviews.Author: smartace
Reviews.Content: It is right on the Bosphorus, and the views are stunning...the breakfast buffet is the most amazing thing I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Service excellent as is the view”
Reviews.Author: sbmc53
Reviews.Content: Ritz Carlton globally has earned a reputation for outstanding customer service and exclusive comfort. Our stay in Istanbul at this Ritz not only upheld this reputation but built upon it by providing us with outstanding care and support. I wish to call attention, in particular, to Mr. Taric Er, who as head concierge assisted us with such warmth and caring that we felt like we were not in a hotel but in a home. Tarik was extemely helpful to us with restaurant reservations, concert tickets, taxi transfers, museum information and much more. We can easily understand why Tarik is the Head Concierge! As far as we are concerned he sets the standard against which we will compare all future concierges. The Ritz is fortunate to have him in Istanbul. All of their staff went above and beyond with their fine service and hospitality. The rooms are large and beds are very comfortable, too. PS: the hotel is 2 blocks from the Dolmabache Palace and is an easy walk.

Reviews.Title: “Service - Service”
Reviews.Author: TCCMD
Reviews.Content: High end hotel with superb service throughout. They quickly learn your name, know your desires and favorite food and drink, and are always very polite and mannerly. You are made to feel special. Great accommodations, wonderful beds, sitting chairs lots of room, lots of windows. Food and drinkmwas always very well prepared. Menu a little more limited than I would have thought however. Breakfast buffet is absolutely great. Location is an issue, with an uphill climb to the main Taxsim area, but if you can afford to stay here, take a taxi they are inexpensive. Free Internet in the lobby, restaurant and bar area, but rather expensive from your room. I had an issue with my VPN as the security certificate for the Internet service they use was invalid and out of date. Hackable??? They need to address that since they appear very security conscious.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the upgrade”
Reviews.Author: MissC247
Reviews.Content: Trying to decide whether or not to upgrade to the Bosphorous view? Worth every dollar it is money very well spent. I loved Istanbul, the markets, the food and the culture. The shopping, the haggling and the coffee. I didn't like the turkish bath, I was in there alone and it was just weird being scrubbed by a stranger. I would have loved it in a bakini with a book! Hotel is highly recommended, The Ritz do we really need to say more? Great food, great wine and excellent service!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite as expected”
Reviews.Author: Love2cook
Reviews.Content: The room was a little tired, could have used a few extra touches. The overall experience was very pleasant. Upon arriving, proceeding through security, the bags on a conveyor belt and walking through a metal detector was unsettling, but I am sure a necessity. The hot tea and turkish delight was very "Turkish" and appreciated. Check in was quick and formal. The room was large enough for comfort. The view from the top floors provided a great view of the area and water. After such a long trip, the hot water, shower and bath tub were a welcome as well as the comfortable bed! We could hear our "neighbours" as the walls are thin. Breakfast was unbelievable, and I am not a breakfast eater - make time for it!!! Over all, we would stay there again, but would go for pleasure not business, as the internet was expensive and couldn't find a business center. The spa services seemed wonderful - just didn't have time to use them. There were places to walk to for shopping and sightseeing, it is ideally located and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the Ritz, you will not regret it!!”
Reviews.Author: wissamsa
Reviews.Content: We booked for 3 nights at Ritz Istanbul, at first we were a scarred because the picture of the building from the outside doesnt look like ur regular ritz. But I must say it is one of the best hotels I have been to (being a traveller who visited many 5 stars hotels all over the world). it is almost 1.5 years since my visit, but I decided to write this review because of some negative comments that I found about this hotel, and I must say they were not fair at all. In brief, my stay was excellent, the rooms are excellent with adorable bathrooms. Excellent staff who gave us early check in although the hotel was almost fully booked (due to the fashionable istanbul event). Breakfast buffet is delightful. I don't know what's wrong with people who write stupid reviews complaining about the location, the ritz offer the best location near the dolmabache palace with amazing bosphorus views. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants and can afford luxury.

Reviews.Title: “''beautiful view of the Bosphorus''”
Reviews.Author: sunny72
Reviews.Content: Definitely the best of this hotel is the view . Ask for the upper rooms to enjoy fully the beautiful view of the Bosphorus . Everything else is also nice : rooms, furniture . There is a huge choice of delicious meal in the restaurant. Also to change atmosphere you can go to the Nevizade Cad in Taksim, where you can find a lot of restaurants which serve fish . The location of the hotel is wonderful, everything is nearby . I will advise to use spa ,it is really nice .

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate & SUPER lUXURY”
Reviews.Author: Mehrishi
Reviews.Content: It was an excellent experience as per the services & location of the hotel. It is located in the heart of city and shares a beutiful panarominc view of Bosphorus. Rooms are huge & spacious & Really luxurious ones. Star Hotel and really a good option for honeymooners. The connectivity is really good with the local transport system as you get all the facilities right at the door steps. You also have all the major tour operators pickup facility at this hotel. Good shopping area & night life around this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, rooms and facilities”
Reviews.Author: busybeaverCanada
Reviews.Content: We were only in Istanbul for 7 days but enjoyed every minute, mostly due to the incredibly friendly and helpful staff and the facilities at the Ritz Carlton. Our room was spacious, clean and enjoyed a beautiful view. We were convenient to the Istaklil pedestrian street, and to finding a tram into the old town. The views of the Bosphorus from our room and the meeting rooms was gorgeous. I especially enjoyed the spa facility, steam rooms and pool area. The hot tubs were not hot compared to N.Am standards, though. The fitness room had everything. We did not need to spend much time here, though, as there is plenty of walking, uphill and downhill, to be had on the streets of Istanbul and we covered a lot of miles every day. It was great to come back to the Ritz for a relaxing night, despite the sounds of the stray dogs outside and the early 'call to worship' from the mosques. All added to being in a different culture. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: dedicated-doctor
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. Large room and beautiful bathroom. As for the location it is not very far away from istiklal street and is in the middle of the hill. Only the first few meters are a little steep otherwise a 10 min walk to Taksim square. I would definitely advise it.

Reviews.Title: “Cosmopolitan Luxury”
Reviews.Author: margmille
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, wonderful view of the Bosphorus, well located, breakfast was perfect as was cocktail hour. The Spa services a definite plus!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the heart of modern Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: crs256
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Ritz-Carlton Istanbul for my honeymoon and could not have been happier with the hotel. The rooms were spacious and clean, the amenities were fantastic, and the staff was extremely kind and helpful. They will literally take care of anything for you (much of it, however, at a price). The hotel's spa and fitness center is great -- a wonderful place to relax between daytime touring and dinner -- you can use the hammam for free when it is not booked for an appointment. The daily breakfast is also excellent, especially if it's included in your room rate. Several people told me that the Ritz was a little inconvenient but I didn't really find this to be the case. It is not especially close to old Istanbul, but a cab ride was only 20 turkish lira, and you can also easily walk to the tram station at the bottom of the hill and take that directly to the sights in old Istanbul. I found it really convenient to Taskim Square, Beyoglu, and Nisanti, all neighborhoods for shopping, dinner, going out. Probably most patrons of the Ritz take cars or cabs but I like to walk and found it a walkable distance from many of these places. Plus, the Bosphorus view rooms offer a stunning view of everything. A very special hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Need improvement...”
Reviews.Author: SwennySG
Reviews.Content: Normally I had a good impression on Ritz Carlton brand and decided to stay for 3 nights. I was surprise the service of the staff from the front office, concierge and room service did not meet the brand standard. Negative â€“ Room service â€“ I have to call 3 times for coffee cup, saucer and kettle with hot water to be delivered to my room. Front Office and Concierge â€“ I wanted to print out some documents. Either one of their laptop USB port is not working or another one could not open my file because they did not update their MS office to 2007 version. Then I have to take the trouble to email the documents to concierge email add for printing. Positive â€“ Room and dining is good. Plus the dining staffs friendly and service is acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Drroady
Reviews.Content: Great place - not that much different from any other RC - great service, food, rooms, etc. Oh - and like all other RC, expensive. We were upgraded to a higher category room, which was an added bonus. Everything was perfect, really. The bellmen knew our names by the end of the first day. The concierge was excellent. We were disappointed in the spa area, but weren't there for the spa so that really didn't matter. The pool water was very cold and the whrilpool in the men's area was only lukewarm. The hotel building itself is an eyesore in an otherwise beautiful Istanbul; looks nothing at all like the typical RC from the outside; you'd never guess it was a RC without the sign out front. The location is a bit far from the old part of town, but extremely convenient for Taksim. Traffic around the hotel was a nightmare at times due to the adjacent stadium games taking place, but that is no fault of the hotel. All in all, a great place; I'll return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “STAYED MANY TIMES IN THIS HOTEL I CAN SAY THE SERVICE IS 5*+”
Reviews.Author: georgelazop
Reviews.Content: Traveling and sleeping in hotels for almost 3 months a year worldwide, i can say, the service of the ritz carlton istanbul is the best i ever had in my many stays there. Hotel is in a very good location, the service is briliant, brekfast is very good. the only point the hotel is weak is that they dont have many restaurants or bars if you decide to stay in. and a short story that i will never forget... i booked a sea front room for friday and saturday and a day later i called them and change it to saturday and sunday, when i arrived the front desk agent told me "mr xxxxx we where expected you yesterday" i told him i called and changed but i dont kept the name of the person i spoke and made this change.. in 3' after he talked to his manager, he came up asking me if i dont mind to give me the presintetial suite because they didnt had more sea front rooms... the cost of this suite is some thousands euros but i just pay my sea front room price. after i check in in the suite... the manager called me to ask me if everything was ok and if i need anything else.. EXCELENT PROFESSIONAL SERVICE very good hotel for business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: barking1RedondoBeach
Reviews.Content: Would of liked the location to be closer to all the attractions of the city. Close to Taksim Square which really has nothing other then chain shops/restaurants to offer. You could walk to the river quickly over poor quality sidealks. Rooms were ok but looking tired and dated compared to other RC properties. Used the Hotel Driver from the Airport but used regular one on return as it was 1 tenth of the price. Pool was inside, would of loved it to have been out side.

Reviews.Title: “Could not sleep at night due to the dogs across the hotel barking for food”
Reviews.Author: Fab2010_11
Reviews.Content: Ok, so 3 regrets I had about staying at this hotel in istanbul: 1.) Being an animal lover this was especially painful...across the street from the hotel I heard dogs barking for food all night, I could not sleep, so sad... 2.) The toilet water stunk really badly and sprayed you like a fountain. Felt really gross. 3.) Got ripped off from a taxi driver and told the hotel to call his cab company to complain and they did nothing about it, just dismissed it. Expected much more from a Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: siba1711
Reviews.Content: Ritz Carlton hotel in istanbul really deserves to be 5* .It has good location ( Bosphorus view) the staff are helpfull and polite.the service was excellent . The rooms are clean and comfortable.It is a luxurious hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lor13149
Reviews.Content: I went to the Ritz Carlton in Istanbul for NYE with two other friends. When we walked in we were greeted by such friendly staff. Everyone had a smile on their face and could not have been happier to help. Since there were three of us we had a roll away which made the room a little cramped, but there was already three of everything that we needed in the room. We had lounge access which was really nice. A wonderful hotel, very clean and very friendly staff. What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nina_Roma
Reviews.Content: the average price is high but everything was just perfect: room, customer service and spa

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views of the Bosphorus in luxurious comfort”
Reviews.Author: Lambert B
Reviews.Content: Attended conference at the hotel, it is very luxurious accommodation with large bedrooms affording amazing views (have to pay extra to get the good view though). As one would expect from a Ritz Carlton, all amenities and details are looked after. There is a good on-site spa and well equipped gym.
