The bar/drink area is small (actually two small bars) for the size of the hotel and they are pretty quiet you have to make your own night life. Internet is available but pricey. The hotel is situated down a hill from Taksim square. In a sense it is walking distance close to everything but then again pretty isolated if you want something outside of the hotel (restaurant/stores) and you have to climb the hill. If you want to go to the old city (Sultanahmet) you should walk to Taksim square, take the Funicular down and then the streetcar for a few stops. It avoids you getting stuck in traffic and you see the real Istanbul. It was faster for me to do this than my friends who took a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, isolated island”
Reviews.Author: Gatorgolfer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of our cruise as part of our cruise package. Long story short, this is a wonderful, luxury hotel in a poor spot. Absolutely nothing negative to say about the actual hotel....great rooms, great common areas, service, breakfast buffet, etc.....albiet expensive. The location offers a terriffic view of the Bosporus, but is a difficult place to base sightseeing. We avoided cabs. The tram to the old section was downhill about 300 years...ok down, pretty damn steep coming back. Trams are cheap, efficient, but pretty crowded. The walk to Taksim Square is uphill....also a couple of hundred yards. Once there you can find lots of shops and restaurants. Since most of the goodies that you want to see are in the old section of town, were I to go again, i would stay in that area, and probably save a lot of money in the process.

Reviews.Title: “What un ugly building, non-existing service.....”
Reviews.Author: DariOlio
Reviews.Content: It is definitely most ugly hotel building in Istanbul. Built illegally and spoiling the Bosporus panorama. Rooms are really fine but location and service are far away from the prices their are asking.

Reviews.Title: “Pampering”
Reviews.Author: emberbor
Reviews.Content: Efficient reception. Clean rooms. Fantastic large windows for great views. Excellent work- out equipment. Spa offers everything. Restaurant is expensive but excellent breakfasts. Bedding very comfortable. Big tub for soaking those tired feet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel , Not close to many tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: likest0travel2010
Reviews.Content: The Hotel and staff were very accomodating. The room was very nice and clean. Beds very comfortable. Very nice, but pricey, breakfast buffet with great view. The hotel was close to a tram line, had to climb down hill to get there. Great location for business hotel, however if seeing normal tourist sights would have prefered to be in closer location to Blue Mosque, etc. Nice fitness center. We were on a pre cruise package, next time would stay closer to older part of city for convenience.

Reviews.Title: “For a few days of out lives, we were pampered !!”
Reviews.Author: dimashqi2020
Reviews.Content: This was the last destination on our itinerary for our first trip to Turkey as man and wife. The staff is awesome. The travel agent messed up by not informing them that our reservations was for a sea view, but they remedied this after a small "incident". After that, it was smooth sailing. Staff called us by name. We could not stop having the "Turkish delights" at the lobby. And walking to the Taksim square in the afternoon is great. Safe City overall, and nice places to walk. The hotel is highly recommended. I would stay there every time. If you go thru a travel agency you will get better room rates rather than booking it yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: Mindy10in
Reviews.Content: After reading some mixed reviews on this property we weren't sure what to expect. We were very impressed and have only good things to say about it. We were debating between the Four Seasons and Kampinksi but found this location and hotel to be much better located and of much better value. The staff was very friendly, the room always clean. We stayed on the Business floor and it was one of the nicest we have been in (compared to 4 other Ritz Carlton business levels we have stayed at.) The hotel is a short walk to Takism Square, as other people have mentioned. This is great if you just want to stay local for dinner or walk around during the day. A couple of times we just hung out for a few hours at the beautiful indoor pool, which was a nice treat and very relaxing. Apparently it is the largest indoor pool in Istanbul. The hotel gym was also very nice. As soon as I stepped on the treadmill one of the trainers there came over and offered me some water. After I finshed I had the whole gym to myself. As in most non-North American countries the gym was not as well equipped as a big hotel gym, but it was certainly one of the best European hotel gyms I have seen, with newer Techno gym treadmills and Technogym weight machines, plus lots fo free weights and ample room. This was a pleasant surprise as many Euro hotel gyms are tiny and have really old equipment. Ocassionally we heard the very loud football game from the stadium outside our window, but it was not a big deal. It was also fun to get a birds eye view of the game.. We also had a Heli-Pad outside our room and it was fun to see the helicopters come so close to our window. The views from all the of the rooms and restaurants are spectacular. I would recommend this hotel to anyone coming for business or for a holiday. It is elegant and quiet with lovely service. As an additional tip, we have read that you can get ripped off by taxi drivers. This is true. We avoided this by carrying lots of small change and making sure the meter was always on and stayed on. The front doormen at the Ritz were also helpful in making sure the taxis knew where to take you.You are always better to get taxis at the hotel or a taxi stand rather than off the street, although smoetimes there is no choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service Polite Staff”
Reviews.Author: Jacksie1809
Reviews.Content: My husband booked us the honeymoon suite as a surprise wanting to pamper me. Our suite was fantastic, champagne, sweets etc were laid out for us on arrival at the suite, they even put rose petals on the bed with heart shaped balloons, all the staff kept congratulating us, ( Even though we have been married for several years, my husband and I felt totally pampered) We had dinner in the very regal restuarant, and was given 5 star treatment, we were given a lovely mouthwatering cake. The outside of the hotel is bland but it's fantastic inside, our suite was lovely. The staff were so attentive but not overpowering. We really loved the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cordial Staff and attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: AmmarMango
Reviews.Content: I loved the Istanbul Ritz Cartlon, and loved its staff even more. Very friendly staff, personal service, and immaculate facilities. The spa was an excellent retreat after a day of sightseeing and walking. Quiet and relaxing indoor pool, steam room, and ambience in general. Small personal touches and attention to details made a big difference; the delicious cherry juice always available with a friendly smile by the reception, the very informative and helpful concierge service, the eagerness to serve and not keep customers wait at the reception, and the assortment of tea they had in their beautiful cafe overseeing the bosphorus. (even though the tea price was as steep as the turkish tea they serve :)) but worth it for the splendid view and excellent service. I have been to Istanbul before and been to the Hilton before. Ritz beat them hands down in my book. If you stay at this hotel, the walk to Taksim square is relatively short (10 minutes easy walk) and very scenic if you avoid the street and go through the park area.

Reviews.Title: “the ritz - unfortunately nowhere”
Reviews.Author: biggeorgeGeorgia
Reviews.Content: we were put in here for two nights by a cruise line so the third expensive night was easier to take. what is there to say about the hotel itself - it's the ritz. great room, great bath room, attentive service, great views. everything is expensive - food, drink, etc. the location is not for touring istanbul. it is in a residential neighborhood with some office buildings. it is a long, uphill walk to istanbul's times square. the only attraction that's close is a sports stadium - we got two free rock concerts out of that. you have to take a cab to go anywhere. they behave themselves when they pick you up there, but getting back is another story with a lot of hassle.

Reviews.Title: “5 star treatment at an excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Don9
Reviews.Content: I was surprised when reading the previous negative review as we had an amazing week at the Ritz Carlton istanbul. We booked the cheapest room (with booking.com) which although hadn't a great view was to a very high standard indeed. The hotel isn't in a poor location as some have stated - it has an amazing view across to the Asia side and Taksim square with a vast amount of shops and restaurants is only a ten minute walk. There was a superb choice for breakfast and the most efficient and friendly staff we have ever encountered. They really could not have done more for you. The outdoor pool area was a bit windy at times but a nice place to chill out or top up your tan. It also had 2 jacuzzis and a bar. We really cannot fault the hotel apart from the over priced alcohol or afternoon tea but you simply head to Taksim square where you can eat and drink at a reasonable price. Definately worth staying here if you are planning a visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A Total Rip-off”
Reviews.Author: bayshores26
Reviews.Content: We had a family reunion in Istanbul. We thought we treat our family to the proclaimed luxury of Ritz-Carlton, how wrong we were. What we found was a terrible experience. The entire setup of this hotel is a complete rip-off (big bucks) in a 3rd world country. First of all, no breakfast as promised during reservation! Then we were told afternoon tea is complementary. After we had the first tea and cookies for four of us (thanks god others in our group didn't join us), we found out that we were stuck with a bill of 180 Turkish Lira (TL) (Equivalent to $130)!! Yes, and I am serious. We asked for transportation to town, and even though we knew Taxi was 12 TL, we were told, "Oh, but the best for you sir/mamdam..., we have a van for you for 120 Euro!! Seems like a LOT of corruption is going on at this hotel. We didn't stay there the entire week, and left after the second night. We could not use the indoor swimming pool, and take our 7 year old niece, instead they order us to use the outdoor pool at a temperature of over 90 degreed, and extreme wind.....yes, this location is always very windy too! We are very sorry that a well anticipated family reunion was turned into a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Old Fashioned elegance in a poor location”
Reviews.Author: elegantraveller
Reviews.Content: On our last visit to Istanbul we chose the Four Seasons in Sultanhamet - a perfect location and a pretty amazing hotel. In selecting the RC, we might have been setting ourselves up for disappointment, for if truth were told, we wouldn't have chosen this for ourselves. Like a huge majority of the guests in the hotel that evening, we were joining a cruise ship the following day and the RC was the best of the hotels offered to us. That cruise part could be a significant factor in choosing to stay here, because whilst we were there, the lobby was always busy with groups coming and going. If I were booking an independent stay in Istanbul, the RC would not feature on my list of preferences. The style is conventional, somewhat old fashioned. The monograms are everywhere - never forget you are staying at the RC, not even when you take a tissue from the RC monogrammed box. The exterior is ultra modern skyscraper - quite at odds with the dark wood panelling inside. The hospitality is both generous and graciously offered - dishes of turkish delight abound, apple tea is offered in the lobby and nothing is too much trouble for the charming staff. Service was first class and everything was spotless and beautifully maintained. Our room, though not decorated to our taste, was comfortable if a little full of large pieces of furniture. Staff were universally helpful and the buffet breakfast excellent. What lets the RC down primarily is the location. Part of a commercial development on a traffic island, walking anywhere from the hotel is taxing. Walking to Taksim Square is not easy because of several busy road junctions to negotiate, high kerbstones and a lack of pedestrian crossings. We are agile and confident enough to deal with such situations normally and yet we still felt uncomfortable and apprehensive about crossing these roads, even though Taksim Square was only a fifteen minute walk away at most. The heavy traffic meant that a morning visit to the old city was not really an option for us and we sought advice from the concierge. He recommended the Dolmabahce Palace, just a stone's throw from the hotel and more easily reached by means of a second elevator which offered access to the other side of the hotel and an easier pedestrian route to the Bosphorus. We spent a very enjoyable morning there and were glad we didn't attempt to go downtown at all. Clearly, if it's a first visit to Istanbul, it would be disappointing not to see the main sights. The situation of the Ritz Carlton does not make that easy, for sure and however lovely the views from the sixteenth floor, whatever level of fantastic service you receive and however scrumptious the breakfast, sadly the RC is just in the wrong place.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Located Luxury Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ms321
Reviews.Content: We stayed here post-cruise and should have listened to a waiter on the ship who told us not to stay here. It is undoubtedly the worst located luxury hotel in Istanbul and perhaps the worst located city vacation hotel at which I ever stayed. It is isolated and has no services -- when you walk out of the hotel you must walk 1/2 mile uphill to Taksim or one mile downhill to the tram to get anywhere. The only tourist site it is anywhere near is Istakal Caddesi. Most of the other sites are on the other side of town. The check-in service was poor. I waited several minutes until I got the attention of a front desk clerk who was busy filing papers. And perhaps It is ironic to complain about prices in a luxury hotel, but the price of the buffet breakfast and a beer or drink in the lounge are the highest I've see. There is no nearby competition, not a restaurant, bar or shop That said, the hotel room was lovely and quite spacious with a great bathroom and lots of luggage space. There was a nice view of the Bosporous from this standard room. As a tourist, you should avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Plush rooms and top notch service!”
Reviews.Author: donnainnapoli
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a fantastic stay at the Ritz Carlton Istanbul. Our room was comfortable and well appointed. The service was positively top notch. Our only complaints are in the food and beverage/amenities department.... The bar was not open once during our entire stay, which was a huge disappointment. The food and beverages served outdoors in the "roof" restaurant were good, but extremely overpriced. And, the outdoor pool was not yet open (we traveled mid-May), as advertised online. I would stay in this hotel again, but if you are looking for a place to lounge by the pool and eat/drink all day, this might not be the best option. However, if you are looking for a quiet, elegant, comfortable room with incredible service, this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurous Hotel but Location could be better”
Reviews.Author: Speedywheeler
Reviews.Content: An excellent Ritz Carlton in bustling Istanbul with the usual outstanding service and room amenities. The beds and bathroom were outstanding, and the staff go out of their way to make your stay at the hotel a memorable one. The only criticism is the location. You can't leave the hotel and walk somewhere close by to see the sights. In this regard, the Kempinski Hotel, which is on the Bosporus, is a much better location.

Reviews.Title: “Ugly on the outside beautifull on the inside”
Reviews.Author: Netherlands
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the RC for 4 nights. The building totally does NOT fit in the sky line but the inside is really beautifull. The staff, food , rooms, pool everything is great. The location of the hotel is in fact very central but it is on a hill so it is hard to go somewhere by foot. You need to take cabs to go somewhere. Probable one of the best hotels in the beautifull city of Istanbul but the 2 four seasons are much nicer. But anyway highly recommended !!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: HelianaCalmon
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband went to Istanbul before a work trip in Greece and Paris ,and we have chosen Ritz Carlton Istanbul because of the price X quality relation .The hotel has not the best location in Istanbul once you have to walk a little bit uphill to reach Taksim Square and Istiklal Caddesi, but the the hotel absolutely worths the walk! Wonderful entrance hall ,super front desk staff, lovely and spacious rooms (we took the park view one, and it was fabulous...i can imagine the Bosphorus view one!! ) ,great marble bathrooms with nice amenities,compliment bottle of water and chocolates every day, super comfortable king bed with super duvets.We got the breakfast included offer through internet (GTA Hotels) and it was great because it was almost a meal. Wonderful turkish yoghurt, best cheeses and breads , all kinds of fruits,freshly squeezed juices and more ,in a wonderful Bosphorus view room! RC has also an amazing LAVEDA spa downstairs (services are extra) ,but the guests are allowed to use the sauna and the AMAZING indoor swimming pool.It has also a wonderful and modern fitness center with all comforts(compliment bottle of water,towels,etc).We could also experience a hammam in the sauna complex,which was a great thing!We absolutely recommend Ritz Carlton Istanbul and would definitely stay there again next time!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ChristineCharlotte
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Ritz-Carlton as soon as I arrived. The staff is pleasant, helpful, and courteous. I arrived very early in the morning, and they found me a room to check into as soon as possible, with a wonderful borsphorous view. The breakfast there is amazing and worth its price, probably the best I have ever had, even better than at other luxury hotels such as the Four Seasons. All in all, the services there are not as overpriced as they usually are in other places, with an affordable very good internet connection. My room was splendid, full of little touches to make my stay as memorable as possible. As usual in Turkey, taxis, even belonging to the hotel, can be crooks, so be aware of establishing your itinerary with the help of the hotel staff before you get in. The spa was amazing, do check our the Hamman massage package. The reception staff was always helpful, even when I came in with a very time consuming and harduous request. The only room for improvement overall would be for the hotel to use organic soaps and creams as opposed to generic brands. Nevertheless, I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!! Great service!!”
Reviews.Author: ninaelkhalil
Reviews.Content: I have booked a double club room from my agent here in lebanon and thanks God I did!! it was really amazing! A very luxurious room with a great view over the city and a part of the bosphor. The club floor is really like your home away from home like one of the reviews said that I've read before booking in this hotel. The staff are great and very helpful. the food on the club floor isn't great but ok compared to nearby restaurants, the menu didn't vary a lot during our 4 days stay! The room i've had was nicely furnished and neat so i really liked it (by the way i'm a very demanding person and i'm not easily satisfied) so you can say that The Ritz Carilton is the best experience for those who seek perfection. The SPA at the hotel was really too expensive, so i decided not to try it and that's what i've regreted the most because all my friends told me that the Hammam is one of the greatest experiences in Turkey! don't miss it! bad luck for me, maybe next time. the hotel is five minutes walk from Istiklal Street, a busy street with lots of shops.At last I say thank you Ritz Carlton for this great experience and I would definitely go back one day!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Almost flawless luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: kb
Reviews.Content: Superb bed, sparkling clean, bottled water replaced at least twice a day, well furnished, comfortable suite with separate living and bed rooms, two big screen TVs, two bathrooms, separate shower and tub, lots of little amenities around like shoe polish, tooth brush, and the usual creams and glop to clean you. Very quiet. It was therefore surprising that the widow curtains were not capable of darkening the rooms. Enough light came in through the closed curtains that I could see shadows in the room in the middle of the night. She liked the standard pillows, I found the requested firm pillows to be lumpy. Although classed as a smoking room, there was no smoke smell present.

Reviews.Title: “Generally fine (aside from the noise from the nightclub downstairs!)”
Reviews.Author: Peepiceek
Reviews.Content: I have just spent three nights at the Ritz Carlton Istanbul. Overall, the experience is comparable to other Ritz Carlton hotels I have stayed at (in Spain and in Portugal). The one caveat to this is that on weekends (and specifically on the Saturday night when I arrived) noise from a nightclub below the hotel can become almost unbearably noisy, and in my case continued until approximately 2 o'clock in the morning - I understand that several guests (apart from myself) complained to the hotel about this. Fortunately this only happened on the night of my arrival and did not recur again during my stay at the hotel! Otherwise, I would just note that the quality of service and overall friendliness and attentiveness of the RC staff were as exemplary as I had come to expect.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing and invigorating experience.”
Reviews.Author: semush
Reviews.Content: In a crowded city which has a bad traffic and so much going on such as Istanbul I don't necessarily expect to relax however Ritz Carlton gave me just that this Christmas. The hotel is situated at a perfect location if you want to visit both the European and the Anatolian sites. It is a stone throw away from Istiklal Street, Ciragan and Dolmabahce Palaces' however it is at a quite location away from the hustle and the bustle of the city. The service is excellent. the concierge staff are one of the best I have experienced. Very knowledgeable, friendly and warm but not intrusive; they helped us finding a good dentist at an emergency. Served in a beautiful Ottoman themed hall, the breakfast is just wonderful. As well as the turkish delights and the "Sahlep", a traditional turkish drink served as a complimentary in the lobby are pleasantries. The rooms are very quite and spacious, even my husband who is a light sleeper had long uninterrupted sleeps. All the other amenities, the spa, the pool, the hamam and the gym was top conditions as well as being very delightful. There is very little negative to say about this hotel except the view is not the best unless you are on a higher floor. It was my second stay in this hotel and I 'd love to return again. :))

Reviews.Title: “Winter getaway at Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Fomych
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in January. If you opt for Bosphorus view than you shall select "full view", otherwise it doesn't make sense. Hotel is from 1st until 17th floor, futher residential floors. City view side is looking out directly to the building of state university, somewhat 200m away upper the hill. Sultanhamet (partial Bosphorus side) can been seen only from top floors, as hotel is located half way on a steep hill and neaby buildings are closing the view. On the opposite side (also partial Bosphorus) view is better, looking out to the city, partially Bosphorus, the Bridge and Besiktas arena. Nevertheless, just below windows there's some parking for buses and communal cleaning machines. So, consider twice which view you're paying for. Benifits of Club Floor do not pay off its extra price, as you also have to breakfast in the Club, where the choice is extremely limited. All in all, hotel is very nice and we fully support previous contributors. Nevetheless, we have already stayed in Kempinski Ciragan Palace 3 years ago and for the next stay, if any, would probably select stay right on Bosphorus. Most probably it would be Four Seasons, adjacent to Ciragan. One tip for dining out which you would not find in tourist guides: there is a great restaurant/bar in the Modern Art Museum, overlooking Bosphorus. Food is very delicious! In warm months they also have open air veranda, literally pendant over water.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, gorgeous view, great location!”
Reviews.Author: robertocusato
Reviews.Content: What a nice hotel! Stayed here (unfortunately) only 1 night and took advantage of a promotional rate that included breakfast. We were upgraded to a partial Bosphorus view room that offered nice views over the sea and Inonu Stadium. Service was attentive and courteous, as you would expect from a Ritz-Carlton Hotel. The Concierge helped us with a bag that was mishandled and lost by our airline, and went out of their way to help us with it. The room was spacious, comfortable and the bathroom was very nice! The only let down was the absence of a kettle/coffee maker that is usually standard fare in top hotels. The SPA was awesome as well, it remembered me of the nice South.Eastern Asia's ones! Nice changing and relaxation area, nice, big indoor pool, jacuzzi, steam room and sauna, and a real hammam is you wanna try the experience. Breakfast was also outstanding - not too much selection but a lot of local bites that made it memorable (especially the spread of Turkish cheese was delightful!). Food/beverages were of the highest quality and the service was impeccable - plus the restaurant afforded generous views over the Bosphorus! Location-wise, the hotel is roughly a 10 minutes walk for Taksim and Kabatas tram station, permitting to reach the main touristic areas of the city fast and cheaply. All in all, a superb hotel where I hope to come back soon! Rating: A-

Reviews.Title: “stop over”
Reviews.Author: Recomendation
Reviews.Content: Great service and unmatchable buffet breakfast!!!Stunning view if you pay for the difference. Business suite is very relaxing. Room had a very bed mattress. The hotel is within walking distance to the busy Taksim square.

Reviews.Title: “No high expectations”
Reviews.Author: cirruspilot
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in the first 15 floors or so of an ugly residential building. Rooms and service just average.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but not up to expectations of a Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: Cinderella_gal
Reviews.Content: Our stay came at the end of a month long tour from Paris, with 21 days of river cruising and we were thrilled that the tour had chose the Ritz Carlton for the last 3 nights. As first timers in Istanbul with only 2 days in the city which were filled with tours, we found the location - a ten minute walk from Taksim Square - to be good, although we did not have to get around the city on our own. The staff at the Ritz Carlton was fabulous, but we were somewhat disappointed that in our spacious room the carpet was stained and worn and the porcelain soap tray was chipped. Others in our tour group agreed that while it was obviously a "grand dame," one does not expect these types of deficiencies in a Ritz. Also, be warned that food costs were exorbitant - a light snack and light dinner in the lounge (NOT the dining room) came to 47 and 89 Turkish lira respectively, which was equivalent to US$32 and US$60. Fortunately we found an internet cafe at Taksim which charged only US$2/hour as the hotel business center charged US$6.50 for only 15 minutes on-line, although we understand that those with laptops could use a hotspot in the lobby for free. When we return to Istanbul - which we certainly will do - we will not be staying at the Ritz Carlton

Reviews.Title: “As you would have guessed...AMAZING...”
Reviews.Author: joeiii
Reviews.Content: What can you say about something so close to perfection? The bed was amazingly comfortable, the service immaculate, the views of the river unmatched. The spa incredible and the extra surprises in your room when you got back from a long day a real delight. All in all a true 5 star, with little room for improvement. My only complaint was I happen to be facing a street party one night for university students and when I mentioned it to the concierge he told me it was the pool music and that it would be over soon. The music continued loud until well past 2am and they finally moved me, however a little reluctantly. Quick side note, be careful with the taxi drivers! Everyone of them tried to screw me. Watch the meter at all times, as they have a tendency to hit buttons that increase the charges or they tell you a price prior to getting in which is 5 X what you should be paying. Cabs have meters, never negotiate a price anywhere and remember cabs are cheap so make the conversion in your head to decide if its too much or not. EVERY cab driver tried to rob me one way or anotherâ€¦.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: MafaldaPortugal
Reviews.Content: There's one thing that you cannot pay on hotels and that is service and simpathy. This kind of service and attention that you only get on classic renowned hotels like the Ritz Carlton. The concierge was just what you look for, attentive and surprisingly dedicated to our requests. Thanks Ritz Carlton

Reviews.Title: “Everylthing but location”
Reviews.Author: Armchairtraveler
Reviews.Content: The Ritz-Carlton is everything its name implies imply: fancy, ostentatious and expensive. The staff is professional and capable, but not as open and welcoming as at less ostentatious hotels, such as the Sirkeci Konak. A weak point for tourists is that the location is isolated from shopping, eating and cultural attractions. Dolmabahce Palace and Taksim Square, the closest points of interest, are each half a mile away - in opposite directions.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday treat”
Reviews.Author: hotel1809
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderfully situated if you want a quiet and elegant place to stay. Everything is in a short taxi ride reach. The staff were wonderful and helpful. Breakfast is a treat and the free turkish delight at the Concierge desk just so delicious. They really took great care of us. We had a wonderful corner room overlooking the water which was worth having. It was a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, didn't like location”
Reviews.Author: StylishTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton, Istanbul for 6 nights. The room was excellent. We had a 1 Bedroom suite. Bosphorous View is worth the extra money. We thought the staff was excellent. However, we found the location a little bit inconvenient. It is in the center of lots of things, but isolated by the hill it is on and the major roads and stadium surrounding it. If you are a good walker, and don't mind hills you should be ok, but it is several blocks to any restaurants or shops except those in the hotel. While these were good, there is not much variety for a longer stay. Everything was a taxi ride for us and the taxi drivers are unpredictable at best about what they try to charge you. If you have a problem coming back to the hotel, just handle it with the doorman when you get to the hotel. We really enjoyed Istanbul, but we could not easily walk to other places and that proved a bit of an annoyance.

Reviews.Title: “Posher than we are used to!”
Reviews.Author: glbkge
Reviews.Content: A most elegant hotel with exceptional staff. We were lucky enough to have a room with a view of the Bosphorous! Wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Hands on the best hotel in Istanbul ,the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Halawala
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel for almost 3 weeks with my family, this is the best hotel in Istanbul. The lobby is bigger than any in Istanbul with a superb Bospherous view. It has trays of complimentary Turkish delight and welcome drinks to suit the traveller. The people working there are very friendly and its so easy becoming their friends during the stay. The rooms are large, althought not huge, but still fairly large. The beds are one of the top three I have slept in, and I have slept in many beds! The matress and bedding are top notch and the Ritz Carlton is famous for the comfy beds. Breakfast is served downstairs and it was extremely crowded and you have to go early to get a table or else suffer a 15-30 wait for a table. The only thing was that the hotel lies in the middle of a hill between the Intercontinental and downhill. Walking uphill to Taksim can be tiresom especially considering the road crossings. If you have a car, or travel anywhere by taxi I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: Cheappleasures
Reviews.Content: This hotel meets the usual standards for a Ritz Carlton. Emphasis above all else is on personal service. They were able to arrange for the two of us a personal tour of Istanbul. Very nice, very appreciated, but very expensive. Be aware that the hotel is situated in the first 6 or 7 floors of the building, the higher floors being residences and office space. You're not going to get the top floor in this very tall building. However, it is situated on a hill, so if you have a view toward the Bosphorus, it will be a good view. That view overlooks a large soccer stadium practically across the street. However, it was not used during our stay and therefore not a distraction. Being located this close to the street does mean that you get some street noise. In my case, that meant some funky combination of Turkish and R&B until 1 a.m. or so. As the hotel is on a steep hill, it's not an easy walk to, well, anywhere. The cabs are plentiful and relatively cheap. The airport is quite a distance from the hotel. If you're taking a cruise, the port is very close - 5 or 10 minutes. This hotel is no different from the other luxury chains in charging for internet access by the day. One day, one of them will wake up and figure out that wireless should be offered complementary, like the business discount chains offer. They do have a metal detector at the entrance and confirm your right to be there with your hotel key card. I didn't find it at all intrusive, but it is different from anything you'd find in the U.S. Overall, a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just what one expects from the Ritz Carlton brand”
Reviews.Author: traderprofit
Reviews.Content: I have traveled the World , staying in many 5 star hotels and live in a city with 9 of the 10 largest hotels in the World, so I truly understand what "5 star" means. The Ritz Istanbul is what one expects from a Ritz . This one has condominiums co-located at the top of the building, as well as a nice gym , outdoor and indoor pools, and a very nice saun/steam room with whirlpool and changing areas. There are so many dining experiences in istanbul that we never ate at the hotyel, and the ice machine on our floor did not work. Room service was prompt with buckets of ice. The concierge was very helpful and made reservations for us at many restaurants. Use this service ! All in, this is a 5 star hotel, but I would not say there was anyone who "went the extra mile" for us, although we didn't need it. It's a big hotel, and so i really didn't expect higly personalized service. Accomodations were luxurious, clean, and quiet. Highly recommended if price is not a major obstacle. Taxis are not expensive, and the location is near Taksim Square as well as within walking distance of numerous mosques. If you have young adults who enjoy partying, , Taksim is the place to go. I'd catch a cab, however, for the nighttime travel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for first Istanbul visit”
Reviews.Author: Rob S
Reviews.Content: Personally, I liked this hotel. It was my first trip to Istanbul and the staff, cleanliness and safety of the property impressed me. A good attention to local culture is experienced when you walk through the lobby. The rooms are large and plush. The business areas are ideal and the restaurant looks over the Bosphorus. Very expensive though!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful! Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: MMCSydney
Reviews.Content: From the breathtaking views to the wonderful Turkish Delights and juices waiting for you in the lobby, this is a thoughtful glorious place to stay. It's the Ritz and it lives up to it's name. The lobby is beautiful, the restaurant is beautiful, the food, especially mezza plate is wonderful and the staff is probably the best staff I have ever encountered. Friendly and helpful, I don't think "no" or "can't do it" is in their vocabulary. The hotel is a bit far from the old city or Taksim, but we LOVE to walk and it is a fun walk from the hotel to the various sights, so it was not a problem for us. Had a Turkish Bath and this was definitely a different experience. The spa was beautiful. Oh, and the Ritz Burger...absolute must at every Ritz...fantastic. Adored Istanbul and adored this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Ritz Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: LivingFab Posted by a Luxury Link traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton-Istanbul May 27-June 2, 2009, during our Girls Week Vacation and enjoyed our stay at the Ritz. Postivite points.... Restaurants: Apart of our vacation package, we were able to eat the breakfast buffet in the main restaurant. The buffet has a wonderful mix of traditional Turkish, European, and Western cuisine. The wait staff immediately sat us each morning and always offered a variety of teas, coffees, and juices. One evening we had a late dinner in the lobby of the hotel (at the Lobby Bar), and sat and watched the wonderful view of the Bosphorus. Again, the late night menu is very tasty with a variety of "snacky" foods (mozzarella sticks, salads, soups), etc. There is also an outside Lounge with heated lamps for the breezy nights. However, only drinks are served here and not food. Spa/Turkish Bath: The hotel offers a full service spa and Turkish Bath. This is a GREAT alternative to have a traditional Turkish Bath in the hotel, but not at one of the many public Turkish baths that are found in and around Istanbul. Two of us tried the Turkish Bath and it was great! I was totally scrubbed down and relaxed by the time my Bath attendant finished. :) Definitely a well deserved treat to try! Staff/Concierge: Very welcoming, friendly, ethusiastic. There was a slight mix-up/miscommunication in the initial rate when we booked the hotel three months prior to our arrival. However, the staff literally did everything possible (with a little help of American Express Travel) to fix the rate. Even when we were going to move to another hotel (nothing personal, but trying to stay within our original budget), they were able to match the rate of the new hotel. Yes, clearly EVERYTHING is negotiable in Turkey. Rooms: We had two rooms on the 9th floor (914 and 915), which were conjoining rooms. This is a perfect set up if you are traveling with a group of 4 or more and/or have two rooms. Room 915 (which was the corner room), was larger than the other room and had an EXCELLENT view of the Bosphorus (see picture attached, as taken from the room view). Points to Consider.... Security at arrival: Upon arriving at the Ritz Carlton Istanbul, all cab drivers (and other vehicles) must be swept for bombs. This was a bit overwhelming at first, but I understand why. You will also go through a metal detector everytime you enter the hotel. Internet/Business Center: I did not bring my laptop along on vacation, but I wish I did! There is free wireless internet in the lobby. However, there is a "business center" available, but its 8 Euros per every 15 minutes! Location: The Ritz sits up on a hill above the main Stadium in Istanbul. During our visit, the Soccer team was celebrating its successful Soccer season--and celebrate they did! For two nights in a row, there was a HUGE HUGE HUGE fan celebration, which spilled out from the stadium and into the streets. If you decide to stay at the Ritz-Istanbul, make sure you inquire if there are any major sporting or other events. As this will be a logistical concern on how to get in and out of the hotel. All in all, I had a wonderful time at the Ritz Carlton- Istanbul. There were some positive and negative points about Istanbul itself, but I'll leave those comments on the Lonley Planet website!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: astulle17
Reviews.Content: I've been there with my close friend and all I remember that I was in a dream :) We had a room facing Bosforos and it can't be any better to sit in front of window, (there is a cosy armchair, it could be used for two) drink wine and watch colors of the bridge changing!!! The service was great starting from cleaness to the very small details (like turkish delights, updated weather forecast brough to the room, etc.) Food was incredible (we had breakfast) and "omlete guy" was too sweet to cook some special breakfast with the smiley. In general I was jelous to myself

Reviews.Title: “Very decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugM
Reviews.Content: Typical Ritz-Carlton hotel: elegant, well-appointed with excellent service. The breakfast is really well done and the space it's served in has amazing views. The room I had also had really nice views of the Bosphorus. The spa and hamam services are also really good. A couple negatives: our first room was over some kind of night club and even though we were on a quite high floor, the thumping of the music was still audible. The staff switched our room per my request, but it was somewhat obnoxious that the Ritz-Carlton would even have a property affected by a night club. Another negative is the location on top of a big hill. Not a huge deal, but it's still kind of hike. I'd stay here again but would strongly consider the nearby Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: GHBRAZIL
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ritz Carlton for 6 days on January. I had an amazing stay! The staff is helpfull and gentle, it's a nice luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Culture and Class”
Reviews.Author: Kamishdelhi
Reviews.Content: The Hotel combines traditional turkish elements with an extremely modern hotel. The breakfast area overlooks the bhosphorus and is a treat. The underground pool is great and the rooms and bathrooms luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: jenny055
Reviews.Content: we went as a family with children aged 11 & 13 yr old. we had a fantastic time. The hotel service was brill. the rooms and the facilities were superb. Buffet breakfast had a wide selection and the use of the pool and spa were an added bonus.Location was fine had a good view of sea.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay-staff is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: lovesublime
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the R.C. as our "home base" while traveling around Turkey. Our first room was very nice, spacious, clean but could have benefited from a carpet replacement. After tyraveling around and returning exhausted, the staff kindly upgraded up to a wonderful suite. We barely got anything done in Istanbul because we were lounging around the fabulous room! We had terry AND cotton robes, Bulgari toiletries, a sitting room with TV, a cell phone (we didnt dare use it) one full bathroom and one room with just a toilet/sink-perfect for two women traveling together. The location is best reached by taxi. If you walk you will be going up and downhill-even if you take the tram to the nearest station you still have a far walk through construction zones and cars whizzing by. The staff was absolutely fantastic. Everyone was friendly and helpful. My friend experienced numerous problems with our travel agency and the people at the desk got on the phone with them and worked it out. They allowed us to store our luggage there while we traveled around. They made fabulous restaurant and nightlife suggestions and were great to chat with. We will definitely stay there again if we visit Turkey! Special thanks to Cenk and Tarik.

Reviews.Title: “Great on the Inside and Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: JimmyN
Reviews.Content: This is an exceptional hotel. The staff are fantastic and the rooms are excelent. Attention to detail in all areas is amazing. The only real downside is there isn't really any outside space. It is the perfect base for business or people who don't like to sit outside!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - on the inside!”
Reviews.Author: frequent_flier_0813
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Istanbul Ritz Carlton for four days over the Christmas holiday. A wonderful experience -- I echo the comments of other reviews with respect to the excellent service, the comfort of the rooms, and the quality of the pool and fitness centre. A couple of things I would point out, however: the hotel is oddly situated. It occupies several floors of a large office building/shopping complex and from the outside is utterly charmless. There is a nice entrance on one side, but it is difficult to reach by car as it is on a long one-way street. From the other side one must enter through this shopping arcade. I had one taxi driver who had never heard of the hotel and got completely lost, even when I provided him with a map. If you don't mind a short walk, the tram is by far the easiest and fastest way to get from the hotel into the old city. The tram stop is about 7 minutes from the back door (through the shopping arcade), and it's a quick and cheap ride. If you're staying at the Ritz Carlton and looking for interesting nightlife, don't miss Istiklal Caddesi (Independence Avenue). It's about 15 minutes away on foot, across Taksim Square, and has countless shops, bars, clubs, and restaurants that are lively into the early hours of the morning. I also took a ferry ride across the Bosphoros which provided great views - but the Asian side was a bit of a letdown. All in all, a great stay, in a great city, in a great hotel. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sakiin
Reviews.Content: We have stopped over in Istanbul for a couple of days break on our way home and stayed at the Ritz Carlton in Istanbul. The hotel is magnificent to say the least and we have never experienced such incredible service before. It was so lovely that it was hard to drag ourselves away from the hotel to go to see the city. We stayed at the presidential suite - thanks to the hotel who upgraded us - and it was beaituful. The hotel is located in the european side and close to all the modern amenities while the old town is few minutes way on a taxi ride. It is close to all modern shopping ammenities and less than 5 mins taxi ride to Taksim Square. The hotel facilities are excellent, staff are very friendly and accomodating and while the Club was closed, all the facilities were made available to us in the main restaurant. There is a spa facility which we did not use but the services offered looked fantastic. Overall I would say this is probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in on holiday and trust me I am extremely fussy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views, superb rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Grumpy_Old_Man_Essex
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights as part of a conference in Istanbul. Sadly didn't spend too much time in the hotel but the room was absolutely outstanding, wonderfully comfortable bed. Didn't eat in the hotel although grabbed some breakfast and the views from the restaurant over the Bosphorus are wonderful. Same applies to the bar during the evening, great atmosphere and attentive, friendly staff. We were then on a very good deal, would normally be out of my budget. Great hotel, strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Could not be happier”
Reviews.Author: JoleneBrussels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz for 4 nights in late October 2008 and had a great experience. Excellent service and attention to detail. We stayed on the club level and were really delighted with all the amenities and the caliber of service. Staff always took the time to do a little extra to make the stay really special. It was my birthday and they wrote me a card & sent me a cake. Our room was made special for the occasion and we received a lovely gift upon checkout. Much has been made in previous reviews regarding the location of the hotel in an area far from the historical sights and on top of a hill...bottom line if you are paying the money to stay at this hotel already, the few taxi rides it takes to get you to the historical sites will not break you budget. Taxis are plentiful and not expensive. The Dolamache Palace is just at the bottom of the hill from the hotel (less than a 5 minute walk) as is the historical tramway which you can also take to the historical sites if you so choose, rather than taking taxis. An added bonus, the RC bar in the hotel provides a great view of the Bosphorus from which we were able to view the Turkish National Day fireworks. We highly recommend this hotel and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz-Carlton style all the way!”
Reviews.Author: fryfrye
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ritz for five nights in a club-level room. This hotel has everything you would expect from the Ritz Carlton including a very attentive staff and plush comfortable rooms. This hotel is actually well located for exploring Istanbul. While it is not in the "old-city" where most of the attractions are located, it does have good access to a tram station that will take you to most of the major tourist sights. The tram is located down the hill from the hotel, suggest exiting on the Mall level and walking down. We were a bit taken back by the way some of the guests dressed while using the Club. Pajamas are not what I would consider appropriate attire. Be aware that the Ritz is also a base for overnighting some cruiseship passengers -albeit a higher end client base. My wife claims that the SPA and Turkish bath were both excellent and highly reccomended. All in all a above average stay, but not the best Ritz experience ever, so only 4 stars for this review.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable modern hotel for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: ozitravlr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights as part of an APT cruise/tour Amsterdam to Istanbul. Very comfortable hotel with friendly, attentive staff. We were not unnerved by the metal detector and security at the door. Our room was quiet, with all the amenities youâ€™d expect from a Ritz. Had a partial Bosporus view. Clean, though the carpet was stained. A/C worked properly, maintained a comfortable temperature. Good bathroom, especially the shower. Laundry service and internet expensive, as youâ€™d expect. Had dinner at Cintemani restaurant, which was an OK meal, beautifully presented. My pide was too salty, but they took it off the bill when they saw I didnâ€™t eat much, and insisted I have a complimentary fruit plate . Restaurant setting also lovely with views of the Bosphorus. (Forget cost of meal, but a glass of ordinary Loire wine was 22 YTL.) Great breakfast buffet, with interesting choices. (Had to leave at 6am on check-out day, which was before the buffet opened, but there were pastries and juice available in the lobby, most welcome). The hotel isnâ€™t near anything much and itâ€™s a pedestrian-unfriendly hike to Taksim Square. You need to take a cab to get anywhere, the first cab we hailed at the Grand Bazaar wouldnâ€™t go to the hotel; the second took us but dropped us up the road a bit in order to avoid a tricky turn. There is an ATM in the hotel, did not check out other facilities as time was limited. The hotel stored some bags for us while we went to Cappadocia and Ephesus, even though we stayed at a hotel in Sultanahmet on our return. The Ritz is a good choice if you are in Istanbul and need to be in the new part, but if you are a tourist Sultanahmet is much more convenient to the most important sites.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Ritz”
Reviews.Author: keen_traveller495
Reviews.Content: An offer to spend 4 days in Istanbul came from our friends unexpected. We did not plan to visit this city, so we did not search where to stay. The trip was planned and arranged and we had to accept that. And we were not disappointed. The hotel transfer was arranged through Ritz. We were pleased to see a mini van (there were 8 of us) with champagne and flowers inside. The hotel is beautiful and elegant. Ritz is Ritz. What can I say! We got aspacious Bosphorus view room. there was a bottle of wine and turkish sweets as a welcome. Restaurant is great. You enjoy both the food and the Bosphorus view from the huge windows. Pool and fitness center are of standard quality. We also noticed that this hotel would be good for seminars and conferences. There are lots of meeting rooms in the hotels. I would absolutely recommend this hotel. It is of top quality.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: BrynMawrBK
Reviews.Content: Okay, this is in many ways a nice hotel. The Ritz chain is my favorite and is generally the most consistent luxury chain in terms of quality. However, on balance, our experience was only average. The exterior is an ugly, off-putting mirrored glass tower that resembles an insurance company's headquarters. The hotel's location on a steep hill inconvenient to shops or restaurants discourages walking, though inexpensive taxis are easily obtained. We were disconcerted by the high level of security: all vehicles entering the property are searched and everyone must pass through a metal detector and put personal belongings through an x-ray machine before entering the lobby. The interior and our room, on the other hand, were lovely, and the terrace bar was pleasant and welcoming, with a fine view of the Bosphorus far below. The downsides: we paid a premium for a Bosphorus view room, and if you stood wa-a-a-ay over in the corner of the window, you could barely see a sliver of the Bosphorus. More problematic, however, was the presence of a large amusement park directly across the street from our room. It started gearing up at dark, and at 2 a.m. the noise, music and car horns were still keeping us awake. By 3 a.m. the place finally closed, but the result was a sleepless night despite a very comfortable bed. One other thing: the hotel seems to have some sort of arrangement with the Blue Fish Restaurant in town. It sends many of its guests there, in some cases when they have asked for reservations elsewhere (this happened to friends of ours who stayed there shortly before we did). It wasn't bad, but it wasn't "the best in town", as the concierge stated. Just be aware.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, wonderful customer care, pity about the hill”
Reviews.Author: JosephineAlice
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this hotel in June and were extremely impressed by the standard of customer care. They excelled at anticipating guests' needs in an unobtrusive and friendly manner and how nice it was to be told 'it's my pleasure' after thanking staff members.We were always greeted on our return to the hotel and given a cold drink and of course there was plenty of Turkish Delight. The breakfasts were excellent. A meal in the outside restaurant was most enjoyable and had such a glorious view. It did not turn out to be too expensive. Our room was large and well equipped, had a delightful welcome tray. Unfortunately it had only a partial view of the Bosphorous.The bathroom with separate bath, shower and toilet cubicles had the best array of toiletries we have come across. As others have mentioned the hill is the one negative factor, it was quite warm and while one can get a taxi, doing so takes the spontaneity out of going out for a stroll or coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: aaaNicosia_Cyprus
Reviews.Content: Dont be put off by the exterior! inside lies one of the most luxurious hotels imaginable! Massive rooms with the most amazing views of the Bosphorus, large bathrooms with bath AND shower, very clean, bed turned down every night with weather forecast for the next day left on your bed. Staff always at your beck and call for whatever you may need (restaurant reservations, tour bookings etc). Amazing breakfast selection with everything imaginable! Hotel spa is out of this world. Make sure you book your Turkish bath therapy, well in advance as we tried to get a slot once we were there and it was impossible!

Reviews.Title: “Ritz-Carlton standard, only more afforable”
Reviews.Author: mjk97
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted four nights, but only two was available due to 5/11 Formula One Grand Prix. Compared w/ other locations, it was delightfully cheaper with close to their standard service. Yea, i saw the same warning card for the window cleaning, but never bothered with it and haven't seen them doing it either :-) Club level breakfast was a bit sub par in selection, but the service staff were excellent albeit short in English. A tip at most Club breakfast (or even regular buffet) - ask for omlet even though they don't have there. Spa massage was O.K., but it lacks the meaning of "Turkish massage" anymore, done by Chinese staff. Guess many things are becoming global. Hotel compound gate was bomb checking the cars and bldg door is manned with airport type security scan. We weren't quite sure whether its normal in Istanbul or its due to recent conflict with PKK. Otherwise, poliltely ushering us to the club level at check-in, welcome kit at the room, bearing well with my wife's complaints, excellent services, i call it a Ritz Carlton. Club manager Mr. Serkan is a busy man, but never complained of my wife's demands. And those endless supply of Turkish delights both at the club and room were very evil things. It still makes me sweat to rid of 2 pounds gained there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service - Poor Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: guru10at
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three nights in May 2008. Club Level Suite. Service was excellent - probably among the best we've ever received. Staff was extraordinary attentive and friendly. They really care about you. Room perfectly clean and well furnished. Excellent King Size Bed. Good Spa with nice pool. A perfect experience. The only thing, we did not understand was the low quality of the breakfast buffet served at the Club lounge. This was far below our expectations. One day it took them 20 Minutes to refill the Orange Juice Dispenser. Fresh Fruit was as scarce as full grain bread. Ritz Carlton should not offer such a low level breakfast in the Club Floor of such a heavenly hotel. We've seen much better breakfast in much less high key hotels.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis of elegance”
Reviews.Author: Paul M
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to stay in a club level room and that was just divine. From the moment we arrived the staff were incredibly attentive and observent. They greated us by our last names before we had even checked-in and insisted we sat and drunk tea before we unpacked. The club level serves a full breakfast and during the day, there are plenty of goodies to eat and drink and even a non-smoking room to enjoy. Dinner is delicious and frankly, it is a shame to leave the hotel. The Ritz Carlton Hotels seem to be successful at finding a subtle balance between high class luxury and with a relaxed enviroment and the Ritz Carlton Istanbul is the opitomy of this type of hotel. The health club and spa are also amazing. One of the best hotels we have stayed at, so AAA+++. One thing for anyone who likes to walk from their hotel - at this hotel you need a taxi, which are very cheap, as it is towards the yop of a steep hill with busy roads around. This does afford some of the best views in Istanbul though!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience”
Reviews.Author: 6x6
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived (4 hours late thanks to Heathrow's Terminal 5 debacle), everything was perfection. Possibly the most attentive and polite staff we have ever encountered with great local dining and sight-seeing tips from the Head Concierge. The room was immaculate with a view of the Bosphorus and a really comfortable bed with crisp linen. Amex treated us to lunch which we were initially disappointed to learn was a buffet. How wrong we were. The selection of cold and hot dishes was inspired and all prepared with astonishing attention to detail. Oh, nearly forgot to mention the never-ending supply of Turkish Delight. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel aside from a strange experience”
Reviews.Author: martinnyc1
Reviews.Content: This is a somewhat limited review as we only stayed here one night and didn't use any of the hotel's facilities like restaurants, health club etc. Check in was quick and easy. The room was typical Ritz-Carlton, very luxurious and plush. The bathroom was very large with a great, seperate rain shower. The bed was very comfortable with lots of pillows. We did have one strange experience. My boyfriend and I were asleep and there was a knock on the door and then it immediately opened. My boyfriend (Turkish) jumped up and asked the hotel employee what he was doing there but I guess he was a startled as we were as he pretty much just ran out of the room. Other than that everything was as expected from a Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “A gem!”
Reviews.Author: Sisdeh
Reviews.Content: The room was immaculate with plush towels, pillows & comforter, a huge tub and seperate shower, nice size sitting area with a lovely view & quiet. I looked forwared to the nightly chocolate treat; a different, decadent surprise each day. The food was extraordinary (room service, breakfast and restaurants). The fitness facility was a healing experience. They have two personal KenisisÂ® machines by Technologymâ„¢ which alone made it worth the stay. A great way to start or end the day. One suggestion I have is that it would have been nice if the demo video was actually visible from either Kenisis machine. Wish I could have taken one home! The cardio waveâ„¢ machine was fun too. The lavendar smell that wafts up the stairway as you descend to the spa is soothing. The indoor pool is pristine. If you are a football (soccer) fan, there is a stadium in front of the hotel within walking distance. Taxi's are inexpensive and the hotel is centrally located. Istanbul is an amazing city full of history and wonder with many must see sites to explore. Can't wait to return to Istanbul and this Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Most of The Ritz In The World”
Reviews.Author: princessbrad
Reviews.Content: I own a condo at the residenses at the Ritz Carlton in Boston, in the US. We get better deals at every Ritz Carlton around the world so i stay at the Ritz Hotels most of the time . I have been in many Ritz Carlton locations and this hotel is absolutely one of the best ones i have ever seen. Decoration is very elegant. Confortable rooms. Views are spectacular if you get front side of the hotel. Top security, x ray cehck in points to get in to the hotel, Very safe, The stuff was very friendly. I liked the indoor pool and spa the most . Food is very good. Location is very good. You can walk to many historical landmarksis ina and Dolmabace palace a very short distance. The only problem of this hotel was the outdoor pool. They need to put one big pool somewhere. But since we do not have any outdoor ipool in Boston at the Ritz Carlton , i guess it was acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Not for those looking forTurkish charm!”
Reviews.Author: Elaineyhb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton Istanbul for 3 nights in May this year. The hotel is ugly and the interior corporate-bland and far from the Old Town. Having said that, the we stayed on the Execuive Floor and our room was of a good size, lovely bathroom and the staff were very helpful. The inclusive breakfast, snacks and drinks were all excellent. There was nowhere to sit outside (the pool and exterior areas had not been opened for the summer) which was a shame as the weather was quite mild. To get anywhere we had to take a cab or face a lengthy downhill walk to the tram. All in all a clean, professional hotel with typical facilities of a prestige chain but lacked Turkish charm - once inside, we could have been in any city in the world.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect property”
Reviews.Author: cr8it
Reviews.Content: We wnet to Istanbul for a couple of days when we were in Greece to see something different. We loved the city, and the Ritz made the stay extra special. This is a first class hotel on all levels. We stayed on the club floor, and contrary to what one reviewer wrote, it did not seem tired in any way (perhaps it has been updated since their stay). The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Since we had little time we asked if there was a taxi we could book for the day. The hotel at first suggested a lim service which would have been about $800 for the day. We really only wanted a taxi, and they have several that do that kind of work for them. If you go, ask them to book Nazir. He was fantastic. His English was excellent, and his driving was great (something that can not be said about all cab drivers in this city). For about $150 for the day we had first class service that took us from place to place, waited for us, and gave us great cultural information. Booking him was one of the best things we did. The hotel also had excellent security, which in this day and age was very encouraging.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: probablestars
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. Firstly, the lobby smells deliciously like Turkish Delight, and there are big plates of it everywhere for guests. Secondly, the service is impeccable and genuinely friendly. Thirdly, the breakfast is wonderful. Fourthly, the pool is beautiful & the gym is good. Fifthly, our rooms had an amazing view of the Bosphorus and the city at night. Finally, as expected, rooms, bathrooms, etc, everything is stunning & beautiful & comfortable. It is worth every single penny, truly.

Reviews.Title: “A flawless experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jillybean16
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in the second week of our honeymoon and LOVED it!!! It was so charming how they made such a big deal of it being our honeymoon, and after the stress of the wedding it was a wonderful reminder that we were there to celebrate! The room was lovely (especially the beautiful marble bathroom), and was luxurious without feeling pretentious. The staff was the nicest, most professional and courteous we've ever encountered (for example, a housekeeper passed us as we were exiting our room to go to dinner, and as we approached the elevator bank we realized she had pushed the elevator button for us on her way past--now THAT is service!). We will definitely be back on our fifth anniversary!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms - but one ugly hotel”
Reviews.Author: TO_Globetrotter
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz Carlton for 5 days because it was the host hotel for a business meeting, and definitely enjoyed my stay. The room was beautiful, the service was excellent, and the hotel was pretty much what you would expect from a Ritz property. However, if you are expecting beautiful architecture, think again! This is about the ugliest Ritz imaginable. It is a tacky glass tower that is completely out of place in Istanbul. WHAT WAS THE ARCHITECT THINKING?!? If you appreciate fine architecture, the Kempinski or the Four Seasons would suit you better. Another thing to keep in mind - the Ritz is hideously expensive. I have stayed in many hotels of the same calibre as the Ritz, but I can honestly say that the Ritz surpasses them all in terms of the price of hotel services. On my first morning, I ordered a "Healthy Breakfast" to my room - orange juice, coffee, granola, and a small fruit plate. The bill was 60 euros! I had two suits and two shirts pressed when I arrived. That cost about 100 euros! You get the idea. As for security, this place is like Fort Knox (this is a good thing, but be prepared).

Reviews.Title: “Quite an experience”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Daman
Reviews.Content: My wife had to go to a congress and so I went with her to Istanbul where everyone stayed in the RC. We had a very nice stay, even if it was in one of the "standard" rooms, the was no way of complaining about the standard package included. Safe, slippers, bathrobes, weather forecast card every night on the bed, some sweets, bottle of water supplied. Security seems to be a big issue, every car is checked even with a mirror to see underneeth. Luguage is passed through an X-ray machine, also every bag when you re-enter the building goes through it. Staff is very helpful, no problem when you need a cab, a map of Istanbul (two kinds: touristic one and detailed with all the streets - but the last one you have to ask specially), also good help in the Spa (Laveda) even if you forget a comb or toothpaste it is no extra effort ! Breakfast looks like heaven and the staff if taking care of everything, also the little details (eg: a friend had her bag with her and after she had put it on the ground they came with a small table to put it on net to her)! Only negative point that I can remember: the double bed had a very warm duvet cover. We asked three times to put a plain sheet on the bed and a duvet cover for only one person, but we gave up because they didn't seem to get it how to do this. One tip: don't let the taxidrivers take you from the old city via taksim to the hotel, it's a longer trip (thay are paid by the miles they drive, not the time) but take the road along the Bosphorus. Most of the times there are no problems and it is much shorter.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: princetonreviewer
Reviews.Content: Just returned from spending six nights at the Ritz Carlton in Istanbul (interspersed with two nights in Cappadocia) and found it to be every bit as good as the reviews here indicate. The service and amenities met the high standards one would expect at a Ritz Carlton, with great views, excellent security, meticulously maintained spacious rooms, well-appointed marble bathrooms and some of the most comfortable beds we've experienced. We were met with apple tea and treats on arrival and a courtesy tray of goodies was delivered to our room shortly thereafter. They uncomplainingly changed our room when we came back from Cappadocia to find ourselves booked into an unacceptable third floor room overlooking a utility building (we were pleased with both our 6th and 7th floor rooms). The concierge was helpful -- bending over backwards to make good recommendations for our dinners. Breakfasts were included with our room most days (part of a weekend rate package), although the 50 lira per person on the remaining days was high, as was the 10 lira price for a cup of coffee/tea. On the plus side, shoe shines overnight were complimentary and the housekeeping and turndown services efficient. This is not a "charming" hotel -- it's a big, modern high rise. It's not within walking distance of most of the historic/cultural sites other than the Dolambechi Palace -- but the cab rides were only 6 to 10 lira and a quick 5-10 minutes to most sites. Walking out of the hotel for an inexpensive breakfast or non-hotel dinner involves hiking up a fairly steep hill in a not terribly nice part of town before reaching the hopping Taksim Square commercial district, where there's a substantial nightlife and loads of interesting places to eat. That said, we would definitely stay here again. The Four Seasons, another of our potential choices, is terrifically located in the Sultanamet area but is a bit more closed in, with smaller rooms and outrageous prices. We did, however, enjoy an afternoon tea break there in there beautifully appointed greenhouse restaurant and it appeared to have the quality and outstanding service you expect from a Four Seasons. We had also considered the Cirigan Palace Kempinski and were happy not to have selected it over the Ritz Carlton (under renovation, rooms in a fairly institutional modern setting with only the public areas in the historic palace and in an even less desireable location than the Ritz Carlton).

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in every aspect”
Reviews.Author: roninMontreal
Reviews.Content: What an extraordinary experience we had at The Ritz Carlton istanbul mid february 2007. The service we received at this wonderful hotel was simply out of this world. From the front desk to the bell hop and the superb guest recognition team, everyone was eager to please. People were always smiling and no request was denied for the 3 wonderful nights we spent there. In the morning an employee from guest recognition would come to meet us in the lobby and ask us if everything was to our satisfaction. She would give us tips on where to go and how to get there, even calling a private hotel taxi to whisk us downtown! When we would come back, we would find a hand written note by manager in our hotel room welcoming us and little treats like a bottel of wine, fresh fruit and little chocolates. A turn down they would even place a card with the temperature for the next day. And the beds, OH THE BEDS!!! They are so confortable, we did not want to leave. The exquisite spa is to die for with that heavenly indoor pool with the ceiling painted as the sky. They have everything from steam room to sauna and jacuzzi. This is the most wonderful hotel experience I had, and the staff of this property are the main reason for the excellence of the Ritz Carlton Istanbul. Go experience it, you will talk about it for years to come!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely - Ritz Carlton Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Peagreen98
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz Carlton Istanbul on business and it was lovely. Liked the focus on security as you enter â€“ your bags are X-rayed. The rooms are large with huge marble bathrooms and I had a lovely view of the setting sun on the Bosphorus both evenings. The staff were helpful, the food great â€“ in the restaurant and the club lounge. The complimentary water was a nice touch and the turndown included chocolates! The staff were amazing when at short notice I needed to two rooms for some meetings â€“ they bent over backwards to accommodate the request and the front of house staff helped me contact the attendees with the details and asking whether people needed cars etc. Always a long row of taxis outside and with the help of the hotel staff - I got to my destination without paying double the amount. I also used the hotel car service which was very efficient and the drivers spoke good English. Not sure Iâ€™d want to stay in this location if I was here on holiday but otherwise a really lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, comfortable hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: waterstone
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at this hotel while on business, in a club level room. Let's eliminate the one con: The hotel does sit by itself on a hill--there's nothing to see or do in the immediate area (though I'd have no problem simply lounging around the hotel and looking at the Bosporus). However, it's not a tremendous walking distance away from DolmabahÃ§e Palace. You could also take an invigorating stroll to Taksim Square or NiÅŸantaÅŸÄ±. There are many pros: Nicely appointed rooms, spacious tile-and-marble bathrooms, and helpful staff. If you have access to the club lounge, you'll enjoy a very nice breakfast buffet (cold meats, smoked fish, olives, cheese, fruit, breads, pastries, hot items, cereal, and--my favorite--fresh honeycomb, straight from the bees!), and the space is great to sit witha drink and wind the day down. In addition to the breakfast buffet are several other buffets through the day with all kinds of treats. The building seems quite secure. Taxis seemed to be always available, and the hotel staff made sure I got where I was going and didn't pay more than I needed to. If you want to be closer to the action, choose a hotel closer to Taksim Square or in Sultanahmet. If you'd like a very pleasant place to stay and aren't put off by having to take taxis, consider the Ritz--I don't think you'll be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheBing
Reviews.Content: Wonderful new world hotel in a fabulous, old city. Beautiful, well appointed rooms with great views of the Bosphorous. Absolutely loved the bathroom! The staff was what you expect from a Ritz-Carlton - and a little better. They went out of their way to make our stay as comfortable as possible. The buffet breakfast everyday was awesome as well. Great location to be in when visiting Istanbul - a 15 minute cab ride away from the old city (though traffic during peak hours can be a little insane) and close to all the downtown attractions, restaurants, and the famous Cadessi Street.

Reviews.Title: “OK but disconnected staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ritz Carlton is a great business hotel in terms of facilities. Sizeable and comfortable rooms, great beds, working broadband and great bathrooms. The issue with this hotel (as with many Ritz Carltons) is the staff that are not really up to scratch. Questions and requests are ignored and there are no learning from previous mistakes. One has to be very clear and do not take anything for granted, check and double check.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for being a tourist/nightlife”
Reviews.Author: GodErnst
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend away from Sofia at the Ritz in Istanbul. I didn't have any view, but with the budget weekend rate I was paying (an outstanding 137 EUR/night with breakfast included) I have no complaints. Hated by the residents of Istanbul due to its obstructing the view of the Asian side (they have an interesting nickname for it), and said that the higher floors will at some point be removed due to rumored illegal construction the Ritz nonetheless currently has THE best panoramic view of Istanbul (particularily the higher floors). I don't agree with the description - you won't be walking from this hotel to any of the major sites (Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia) but it is a relatively short cab ride to the Old City. It's also nicely positioned between the Old City & the newer part where you will end up heading to enjoy restaurants/nightlife. Spacious room, impeccable service & all the other amenities one would expect (at least one such as myself who is not accustomed to such luxury hotels) from a Ritz-Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: RJKHawaii
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz-Carlton twice during a 3 week trip to Turkey and both stays were perfect. The entire staff was friendly yet very professional, and the rooms are excellent. I would especially recommend staying on the Club floor, as the Club staff is excellent and the wonderful breakfasts etc., are more than worth the extra cost. The spa is also very good, especially after spending time in Istanbul's traffic and congestion. The location is 1 or 2 blocks less convenient than the hotel's principal competition, but I would still pick this hotel over them.
